title: Grammys Snubs and Surprises: Taylor Swift, Lil Nas X and More
description: Lizzo, Billie Eilish and Lil Nas X led the Grammy nominations on Wednesday, putting a new generation of pop stars in the spotlight after they stormed both streaming and radio on their way to becoming household names. But who got left out, and what do the nominees say about the past year in music and the direction the Grammys are heading? Heres a guide to the days big takeaways, snubs and surprises.

title: Could New York City Eliminate Free Street Parking?
description: For drivers, finding a parking spot in New York City is already hard enough. There are so many regulations. So many hydrants. So many loading zones. And so few empty spaces.

title: Trump Is Doing Exactly What He Was Elected to Do
description: The impeachment effort against President Trump hinges on his motives. Presidents have wide discretion when dealing with foreign governments, and Mr. Trumps actions have all been within the scope of his offices power. But has he used that power for personal gain?

title: What Democrats Need to Know to Win Latinos
description: By the evidence of the Democratic primary so far, its clear that no leading Democratic candidate has any idea of how to engage Latinos. The Latino electorate has always been complex, a reality that Democratic candidates, consultants and election experts fail to grasp or simply ignore.

title: AIDS Memorial Quilt to Return Home to San Francisco
description: The AIDS Memorial Quilt, a vast network of patches commemorating the lives of people who have succumbed to illnesses related to the disease, will return to San Francisco, where its first panels were created in 1987.

title: Why Alcatraz Matters to Native Americans
description: In the same way Montgomery, Ala., is widely viewed as the birthplace of the civil rights movement, Alcatraz Island should be recognized as the launchpad for the current era of Native American rights and activism.

title: 5 Key Things We Learned From Gordon Sondland
description: Follow our live coverage of Fiona Hill and David Holmes testimony in the Trump impeachment hearings.

title: U.K. Conservative Party Scolded for Rebranding Twitter Account
description: LONDON  The governing Conservative Party in Britain was criticized by Twitter on Wednesday for attempts to mislead people after it temporarily changed the name of one of its accounts on the social media site to factcheckUK.

title: Sleeping Fewer Than 5 Hours a Night Tied to Bone Problems
description: Sleeping too little may increase the risk for osteoporosis.

title: Review: Philip Glass, at 82, Unveils His First Piano Sonata
description: Thousands of people took in the bronzed, glacial grandeur of Philip Glasss Akhnaten at the Metropolitan Opera on Tuesday evening. A couple of miles downtown, a far smaller group heard a very different Glass  lively and sly; intimate and changeable  as Maki Namekawa gave the American premiere of his new piano sonata, his first venture into that genre, at the Morgan Library & Museum.

title: Christmas Season Starts in November. Deal With It.
description: Like clockwork, Mariah Carey was on it. In the early hours of Nov. 1, the singer posted a video on Instagram marking the end of Halloween and the official start of the Christmas season, falling asleep in her 80s glam rock costume and awakening in holiday-themed pajamas at the stroke of midnight.

title: Confederate Statue in North Carolina Comes Down After 112 Years
description: A Confederate monument in the small town of Pittsboro, N.C., was removed early Wednesday from the spot outside a courthouse where it had stood for 112 years, county officials said, bringing to an end months of debate and occasionally violent protests over its presence.

title: I Followed the Direction of the President: Sondland Testifies at Impeachment Hearings
description: Gordon D. Sondland, the U.S. ambassador to the European Union, told the House Intelligence Committee that President Trump directed him to work with Rudy Giuliani on matters related to Ukraine.

title: Tom Hanks, Iman and Alexander Skarsgard on the Town
description: A shopping benefit for Housing Works, and a screening for A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood.

title: Mrs. Rogerss Neighborhood
description: Patricia Clarkson has advice for getting bargains at charity sales.

title: Tell Us About Your Neighborhood Bodega
description: To outsiders, they may appear to be little more than corner stores. But in New York, we know that the bodega means so much more.

title: Wayne Messam Drops Out of 2020 Presidential Race
description: Wayne Messam, the mayor of Miramar, Fla., has ended a presidential campaign that barely got off the ground.

title: One Thing You Can Do: Know Your Climate Facts
description: Welcome to the Climate Fwd: newsletter. The New York Times climate team emails readers once a week with stories and insights about climate change. Sign up here to get it in your inbox. And, to keep up on climate news the rest of the week, follow @NYTClimate on Twitter.

title: After For Sama, a Syrian Family Finds Refuge in London
description: This article contains spoilers for the documentary For Sama.

title: Oxford Names Climate Emergency Its 2019 Word of the Year
description: Oxford Dictionaries has named climate emergency as its 2019 Word of the Year, choosing it from an all-environmental shortlist that also included climate action, climate denial, eco-anxiety, extinction and flight shame.

title: Raymond Poulidor, Cyclings Eternal Second, Is Dead at 83
description: Raymond Poulidor, a French cyclist who never won the Tour de France but became celebrated as a folk hero for his repeated near misses, died on Nov. 13 in a hospital outside Limoges, France. He was 83.

title: Overlooked No More: Pauline Boty, Rebellious Pop Artist
description: This article is part of Overlooked, a series of obituaries about remarkable people whose deaths, beginning in 1851, went unreported in The Times.

title: G.M. Sues Rival Over Bribery Scheme as Union Scandal Expands
description: General Motors sued its rival Fiat Chrysler on Wednesday, asserting that it bribed United Auto Workers officials in contract negotiations to get a leg up on G.M. over the course of a decade.

title: What Do We Hear When Women Speak?
description: Carole Simpson, a longtime television newscaster, was told early in her career that she could not be an anchor because women dont like to hear other women on the air.

title: Scientists Are Just Beginning to Understand Mysterious DNA Circles Common in Cancer Cells
description: Theres no image in biology more iconic than our chromosomes  all 23 pairs of DNA bundles arrayed in a genetic lineup. But in a surprising number of cases, this picture leaves out something very important.

title: After Disastrous Epstein Interview, Prince Andrew Steps Down From Public Duties
description: LONDON  Prince Andrew announced on Wednesday that he would step back from public life, seeking to contain a firestorm over his ties to the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein that threatened to scorch the entire British royal family.

title: Obama Moves Off Political Sidelines, Earlier Than He Expected
description: WASHINGTON  Barack Obama had a plan of sorts for the 2020 presidential primaries, according to several allies and advisers: Stay out of the way, offer advice when asked, promote voting rights, finish a new memoir  then jump back into politics after Democrats picked their nominee.

title: Four Directors Cast Out of Hollywood. Four Different Futures.
description: France delivered mixed messages about Roman Polanski and cancel culture over the last week.

title: Charles Barkley Is Accused of Threatening a Female Reporter
description: A political reporter has received an apology from Charles Barkley, the Turner Sports commentator and N.B.A. Hall of Famer, after she publicly accused him of making a threatening comment to her.

title: A Rose Is a Rose Is  Your Experience of a Rose? A Writer Plumbs Consciousness
description: Lets get right to the overwhelming question: What does it mean to experience something?

title: When Snakes Had Use for a Pair of Legs
description: Snakes, with their sleek bodies and kaleidoscopic diversity, have long entranced humans. But we know very little about the evolutionary past of these legless lizards because of a scarcity of fossils left by snake ancestors that shared the earth with dinosaurs.

title: F.B.I. Sought to Interview Whistle-Blower in Ukraine Case
description: WASHINGTON  The F.B.I. sought last month to interview the whistle-blower who helped ignite the impeachment inquiry as a witness in a continuing investigation, several people familiar with the matter said.

title: Frozen in Place: Americans Are Moving at the Lowest Rate on Record
description: WASHINGTON  Americans are moving at the lowest rate since the government started keeping track, according to Census Bureau data released on Wednesday, as deep changes in the economy and the housing market increasingly freeze Americans in place.

title: Walter J. Minton, Publisher Who Defied Censors, Dies at 96
description: Walter J. Minton, who as president of G.P. Putnams Sons published Vladimir Nabokovs Lolita, the 18th-century novel known as Fanny Hill and other sexually explicit works that rankled the guardians of decency but broke ground against censorship, died on Tuesday at his home in Ponte Vedra Beach, Fla. He was 96.

title: Man Is Stabbed and Slashed Steps Away From a Synagogue in New York
description: An Orthodox Jewish man was stabbed and slashed in a suburb near New York City on Wednesday morning, steps away from a local synagogue, and left bleeding on the ground, the police said.

title: Fed Unlikely to Cut Rates Again Unless Economy Shows Signs of Weakening
description: WASHINGTON  Federal Reserve officials do not plan to cut interest rates again unless economic data begins to show cracks, a message reinforced by the minutes from their October meeting.

title: Sondland Says He Followed Trumps Orders to Pressure Ukraine
description: WASHINGTON  An ambassador at the center of the House impeachment inquiry testified on Wednesday that he was following President Trumps orders, with the full knowledge of other top administration officials, when he pressured the Ukrainians to conduct investigations into Mr. Trumps political rivals in what he called a clear quid pro quo.

title: How the Collapse of Local News Is Causing a National Crisis
description: School board and city council meetings are going uncovered. Overstretched reporters receive promising tips about stories but have no time to follow up. Newspapers publish fewer pages or less frequently or, in hundreds of cases across the country, are shuttered completely.

title: Theyre Actual Supporting Actors, and Oscar Should Take a Look
description: Memo to Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins and Willem Dafoe: We love you, but youre kind of getting in the way.

title: When Book Deals Get Politicians Into Hot Water
description: Under normal circumstances, any author who raked in $600,000 for a series of self-published childrens books would be snapped up by a prestigious publisher and handed a lucrative multi-book deal.

title: Greece Announces Steps to Shut Down Notorious Refugee Camps
description: ATHENS  The Greek government said on Wednesday that it would replace intensely overcrowded migrant camps on the Aegean Islands with new centers that would be more restrictive of the migrants movements.

title: Google Hires Firm Known for Anti-Union Efforts
description: Google has hired an anti-union consulting firm to advise management as it deals with widespread worker unrest, including accusations that it has retaliated against organizers of a global walkout and cracked down on dissent inside the company.

title: Vacillating Trump Supporter, Take Two
description: The last column I wrote was about a lifelong Republican, Chuck Hardwick, who voted for Trump in 2016 and is unsure how he will vote a year from now. Id gotten to know Hardwick and concluded he was an interesting man with an open mind, and a good bellwether for how centrist Americans view the election.

title: The Next Decade Will Be Just as Bad
description: We will remember the 2010s as a grifters paradise. These were the years when our collective sense of objective reality totally fell apart and when politics, business, technology, culture and even ordinary life fell fully under the sway of a new breed of swindler, huckster, influencer, troll and hacker.

title: Vindmans Lawyer Asks Fox News to Retract Espionage Allegation
description: Lt. Col. Alexander S. Vindman is hitting back at the smear campaign against him.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Hong Kongs schools have reopened, and officials are trying to restore a sense of normalcy, though a few protesters remain holed up on the campus of Polytechnic University.

title: Almaas Elman, Somali-Canadian Activist, Is Shot Dead in Mogadishu
description: A Somali-Canadian aid worker and activist was shot dead on Wednesday in Mogadishu, a police official said, dealing a new blow to efforts by the Somali diaspora to return home and help rebuild the country after decades of war.

title: Will Sondlands Testimony Shake Loose the Truth?
Gordon Sondland Leaves Us With No Other Option
description: History will remember Wednesday as the day a United States ambassador testified under oath before Congress and laid out a clear, simple and damning case that President Trump abused the power of his office and committed bribery, an act for which the Constitution leaves but one outcome.

title: I Want Nothing, Trump Says, Quoting From Sondlands Testimony
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump sought to defend himself from hours of damaging congressional testimony on Wednesday from Gordon D. Sondland, his ambassador to the European Union, by focusing on one detail of the envoys lengthy account: a phone call in September in which the president denied withholding military aid to Ukraine as leverage to pressure that countrys leaders to announce investigations into his political rivals.

title: Who Is Laura Cooper? Pentagons Russia-Ukraine Expert to Testify in Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  As the deputy assistant secretary of defense for Russia, Ukraine and Eurasia, Laura K. Cooper was one of multiple Pentagon officials who warned the White House that freezing congressionally approved aid to Ukraine could violate the law.

title: Who Is David Hale? Top State Dept. Official Will Testify in Impeachment Hearing
description: WASHINGTON  Why Marie L. Yovanovitch, the ambassador to Ukraine, was recalled from her post two months early has become a central question in the Democratic-led impeachment inquiry into whether President Trump tried to pressure the country to investigate his political rivals. On Wednesday, David Hale, the State Departments No. 3 official, will be pressed to provide answers.

title: After False Drug Test, He Was in Solitary Confinement for 120 Days
description: Michael Kearney could not understand how he had tested positive for drugs. He stared in disbelief at the corrections officers in an upstate New York prison where he was serving time. Though he had once been addicted to crack cocaine, he had been clean for two years.

title: Climate Warnings: Dont Blame the Scientists
description: To the Editor:

title: Teslas Winding Road to Berlin
description: GRNHEIDE, Germany  The visitors from Palo Alto, Calif., were shown how Berlin, a hive of tech start-ups that likens itself to Silicon Valley, is just a short commute away.

title: The Flooding of Venice: What Tourists Need to Know
description: One month after Venice endured devastating high tides, The Associated Press reported on Monday that the Italian city is again facing exceptionally high-water levels.

title: Oxygen on Mars Adds to Atmospheric Mysteries
description: There is not much air on Mars  the atmospheric pressure there is less than one one-hundredth of what we breathe on Earth  but what little is there has baffled planetary scientists.

title: A Temple to Techno Opens in Queens
description: Anyone nostalgic for the Budapest underground club scene circa 1990 will be in their element at Basement, a subterranean nightclub in industrial Queens dedicated to techno music. Drawing inspiration from Berghain in Berlin and the vibrant raves of former Eastern bloc countries, Basement is a conscious (some might say self-conscious) throwback to the pre-iPhone, pre-bottle-service era of clubbing (minus the reek of stale booze and cigarettes).

title: Modern Love Podcast: Greta Gerwig Reads Sharing a Cab, and My Toes
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: Via Apple Podcasts | Via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Trumps F.D.A. Nominee Sidesteps Questions About Banning Flavored Vaping Products
description: President Trumps nominee for Food and Drug Administration commissioner, Dr. Stephen M. Hahn, declined to answer questions from senators in both parties about whether he would push for a ban on flavored vaping products at a confirmation hearing Wednesday.

title: An Illustrated Guide to Hedi Slimanes Celine Fragrances
description: Hedi Slimane has been the creative director at Celine for just three seasons, but he has been gathering material for his first collection of fragrances for the Parisian house for far longer. The nine unisex scents he released last month (with two more to follow in 2020) draw on the designers olfactory journal, a record of scent memories that extends from his childhood in Paris to the decade he lived in Los Angeles before returning to France last year. I created Celine Haute Parfumerie with the intention to wear every single fragrance of the collection, he says. It is all quite personal. Among the six fragrances designed for the daytime is Saint-Germain-des-Prs, a blend of neroli, petitgrain and white orris butter that harks back to the designers 20s, spent skipping between cafes, cinemas and the Jardin du Luxembourg. The three night perfumes, meanwhile, include Reptile, a musky mix of cedar, pepper and leather designed to conjure the lustrous glimmer of jet-black sequins.

title: Pumpgirl Review: Gas for Sale but Dreams on Hold
description: If romance is like a pleasurable race that promises bliss at the finish line, tragedy is realizing that youre running that track completely alone, with no spectators, no cheerleaders, and the end point moves further away the closer you seem to get to it.

title: 10-Year-Old Boy Who Was Shot at High School Football Game Dies
description: PHILADELPHIA  When the Philadelphia Eagles decided to host the remaining minutes of a New Jersey high school football game that was interrupted by gunfire last week, it was supposed to be a chance to write a new narrative: that violence would not win.

title: The Met Operas Credit Outlook Darkens After Modest Deficits
description: The Metropolitan Opera has run small deficits for the past two years and faces rising capital expenses  including for the repair of its white travertine exterior  prompting S & P Global Ratings to announce on Wednesday that it was keeping the companys A credit rating but revising its outlook to negative, from stable.

title: Im 17 Years Old, and Im Terrified: The Issues Our Readers Hope Come Up at the Democratic Debate
description: Discussions about health care have dominated the six previous nights of debates among the Democratic presidential candidates. Ahead of Wednesday nights debate in Atlanta, we asked our readers what issue they most wanted the candidates to address, and why it mattered to them and their families.

title: 5 Things to Avoid on Black Friday
description: To make the most of Black Friday, follow the Wirecutter Deals page, where Wirecutter staff members will be constantly updating their list of researched deals that are actually worth your time.

title: How to Defuse Tension at the Dinner Table During the Holidays
description: For many of us, the holidays are the ultimate stress test: travel snags, the pressure to make things perfect, the sometimes overwhelming holiday cheer  not to mention the family drama.

title: Thich Tri Quang, 95, Galvanizing Monk in South Vietnam, Dies
description: Thich Tri Quang, a charismatic Buddhist monk who helped bring down United States-backed governments in South Vietnam during the war-torn 1960s and pushed for a democratic nation with freedom of religion, died on Nov. 8 in the city of Hue. He was 95.

title: The Big Business of Unconscious Bias
description: Recently, a story circulated within the diversity, equity and inclusion industry (D.E.I.), one that somehow didnt go viral on social media: At an unnamed company, co-workers were taking their seats before a sensitivity training workshop began, when some white male employees entered as a group with targets pinned to their shirts  a sartorial statement about their anticipated persecution.

title: How to Have Closer Friendships (and Why You Need Them)
description: Like so many people, I grew up watching the TV show Friends, dreaming of the day I would be living a glamorous city life surrounded by a group of close friends. Over the years, Ive made lots of friends: childhood friends, work friends, college friends, writer friends. I have friends who like to hike, and friends who like to chat over coffee and friends who live far away but whom I talk to a few times a year.

title: Bombshells and Cringe Jokes on a Huge Day of Testimony
description: The explosions at the House impeachment hearings Wednesday were not the work of a mad bomber. The man deploying the bombshells seemed oddly to be enjoying himself.

title: Arab Thinkers Call to Abandon Boycotts and Engage With Israel
description: Boycotting Israel is a failure, and has only helped that country while damaging Arab nations that have long shunned the Jewish state, according to a small new group of liberal-minded Arab thinkers from across the Middle East who are pushing to engage with Israel on the theory that it would aid their societies and further the Palestinian cause.

title: 5 Takeaways From the November Democratic Debate
description: With polls showing a highly competitive primary race and no clear front-runner, the Democrats in Wednesdays debate acted as if they had decided ahead of time to avoid taking risks or doing much of anything that might cause them to lose momentum at this stage of the campaign.

title: Remembering National Book Award Winners of the Past
description: A historian, two poets, a presidential biographer and two celebrated novelists: They were among the National Book Award winners whose lives were chronicled by The New York Times in obituaries over the past two years. (This years winners were announced Wednesday night in a ceremony in Manhattan.) Links to the obituaries are provided below.

title: Gordon Sondland, Debate, Google: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Surprising Engineering Behind Everyday Objects
description: DuPont is designing, developing and testing the materials that propel healthcare forward. Our innovation is everywhere, even if you cant always see it.

title: Everyone Was in the Loop
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: Via Apple Podcasts | Via Spotify | Via Stitcher

title: Google Policy Change Upends Online Plans for 2020 Campaigns
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Google will restrict how precisely political advertisers can target an audience on its online services, the company announced on Wednesday in a move that shook up the digital plans for campaigns during the 2020 presidential election.

title: Uber Embraces Videotaping Rides, Raising Privacy Concerns
description: SAN FRANCISCO  For several months, some Uber passengers in Texas have been recorded on video as they have been driven to their destinations. The video has been stored online and could have been reviewed by members of Ubers safety staff if the driver had reported a problem with the passenger.

title: James Wiseman of Memphis Can Return From Suspension in January
description: The N.C.A.A. ruled on Wednesday that James Wiseman, the freshman basketball star for Memphis, could return to the court in mid-January, after he has served a 12-game suspension because Memphis Coach Penny Hardaway gave Wisemans family $11,500 in moving expenses when he was in high school.

title: Carolyn Maloney Elected First Woman to Lead House Oversight Panel
description: WASHINGTON  House Democrats elected Representative Carolyn B. Maloney of New York on Wednesday to lead the Oversight and Reform Committee, making her the first woman ever to head the crucial investigative panel at a time when it is helping conduct the impeachment inquiry into President Trump.

title: Taylor Swift, Lizzo, Lana Del Rey: Pop Stars (and Their Fans) Clap Back
description: This weeks Popcast examines how artists leverage their power, their fame and the crowdsourced enthusiasm of their fans.

title: Read Laura Coopers Prepared Opening Statement From the Impeachment Hearing
description: Laura K. Cooper, a top Defense Department official in charge of Russia and Ukraine, appeared in front of the House Intelligence Committee on Wednesday during the fourth day of public hearings in the impeachment inquiry.

title: Sondland Has Implicated the President and His Top Men
description: Everyone was in the loop. It was no secret.

title: Pompeo Emerges as a Major Trump Enabler in Ukraine Affair
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has for months deflected questions about whether the Trump administration demanded political favors from Ukraine in exchange for military aid. He has refused to explain why he recalled the American ambassador, declared that it was inappropriate for his diplomats to testify before Congress and declined to hand over documents to impeachment investigators.

title: Lawyer With Iconoclastic Bent Navigates Sondland Through Testimony Issues
description: WASHINGTON  The Republican strategist Karl Rove told a federal grand jury conducting a high-profile investigation in 2004 that he had never talked to a journalist who disclosed the identity of an undercover C.I.A. officer. Eight months later, he advised that he had refreshed his recollection: Actually, he had talked to the journalist.

title: U.S. Bill Supporting Hong Kong Rights Heads to Trumps Desk
description: A bill compelling the United States to support pro-democracy activists in Hong Kong could arrive on President Trumps desk as soon as Thursday morning, potentially complicating the administrations talks with China to end the trade war.

title: Donald Trumps Gordon Problem
description: Over the first three days of testimony in the impeachment inquiry into Donald Trump, Republicans have tried out a number of defenses. After the Wednesday testimony of Gordon Sondland, Trumps ambassador to the European Union, almost all of them have been incinerated.

title: Prosecutors Subpoena Trump Fund-Raisers Linked to Giuliani Associates
description: WASHINGTON  Federal prosecutors in Manhattan issued subpoenas in recent weeks to several players in President Trumps fund-raising apparatus as part of an investigation into two associates of Rudolph W. Giuliani who have been charged with violating campaign finance laws, according to people familiar with the investigation.

title: The Strangely Happy Envoy: Sondland Jokes, and Spreads Heat
description: WASHINGTON  Gordon D. Sondland began his day looking strangely happy. The American ambassador to the European Union wore an amused grin as he walked into his hearing and took his seat and oath.

title: Apple Pulls Samuel L. Jackson Movie From Festival, Citing Concerns
description: Apple canceled the premiere of The Banker, starring Samuel L. Jackson, on Wednesday, yanking the movie from its prestigious closing-night Thursday slot at the American Film Institutes annual festival in Los Angeles.

title: Should Trump Tromp Rudy?
description: Memo to Donald Trump: Throw Rudy Giuliani under a bus.

title: Analysis of the Nov. 20 Democratic Debate
description: Our reporters are providing real-time analysis of tonights Democratic debate, with 10 presidential candidates on stage. Join us to follow along.

title: In an Echo of Watergate and John Dean, an Adviser Points to Trump
description: WASHINGTON  Gordon D. Sondland had not even finished his testimony on Wednesday before it was being called the John Dean moment of the President Trump impeachment drama. With the presidency on the line, a once-trusted lieutenant pointed the finger at Mr. Trump in a proceeding that could lead to Watergate-style charges of high crimes and misdemeanors.

title: At the Heart of Serbias Tennis Success Story
description: MADRID  Before there was Novak Djokovic, there was Janko Tipsarevic.

title: Impeachment Briefing: What Happened in Sondlands Hearing
description: It was a pivotal day in the impeachment investigation, as an ambassador detailed what he said was a clear quid pro quo directed by President Trump. Heres a recap of the big moments.

title: As Admiral Moved to Expel a Navy SEAL, He Kept an Eye on Trump
description: [Update: President Trump on Thursday reversed a Navy decision to oust Edward Gallagher from SEALs.]

title: Which Candidates Got the Most Speaking Time in the Democratic Debate
description: The candidates spent the most time touting their own electability and plans to beat President Trump.

title: Corrections: Nov. 21, 2019
description: An article on Wednesday about testimony in the House impeachment inquiry misstated the country that was said to have conspired with Democrats in 2016, a theory that has been debunked. It was Ukraine, not Russia.

title: Trump Floats Tariff Exclusions for Apple at Texas Manufacturing Plant
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump said on Wednesday that China had not yet made enough concessions to secure a trade deal with the United States and suggested that he might exempt Apple from an upcoming round of tariffs as he toured a Texas plant that assembles Mac Pro computers.

title: Live From the National Book Awards
description: Photos from this years National Book Awards, one of the most prestigious literary prizes in the United States.

title: On a Dry Spreadsheet, a Stark Difference: A $200,000 Pay Gap
description: With income inequality a focus of the current presidential candidates, workers in journalism, advertising and book publishing have anonymously posted salary information on crowdsourced spreadsheets, many of them hoping their efforts will lead to higher pay.

title: Elizabeth Warren Says Gordon Sondland Bought His Way to Ambassadorship
description: It was a moment Senator Elizabeth Warren was prepared for on the debate stage, capitalizing on a day of bombshell testimony by the United States ambassador to the European Union in the impeachment inquiry to highlight the fact that her anti-corruption platform included a pledge to not give ambassador posts to big donors.

title: Massachusetts to Ban Menthol Cigarettes as Well as Flavored Vapes
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Massachusetts has moved a step closer to banning all flavored e-cigarettes and tobacco products, including menthol cigarettes, amid a national push to contend with the risks of vaping.

title: Susan Choi Wins National Book Award for Trust Exercise
description: Susan Choi won the National Book Award for fiction on Wednesday night for Trust Exercise, a novel set in the 1980s at a competitive performing arts school, where two students fall in love. The judges praised the novel for blending the intellectual rigor of post-modern technique with a story that is timely, mesmerizing, and in the end, unsettling.

title: With Impeachment as Backdrop, Democrats Direct Fire at Trump in Debate
description: The Democratic presidential candidates yielded to the furor surrounding the impeachment inquiry in Washington in their primary debate on Wednesday, for the first time training their fire more steadily on President Trump than on one another and presenting a largely united front on vital issues like climate change and abortion rights.

title: A Christmas Carol Review: God Rest Ye Merry, Plutocrats
description: Have any of the progressive presidential hopefuls still duking it out thought about working A Christmas Carol into their campaigns? If so, they would surely benefit from visiting the new, charmingly instructive adaptation of Charles Dickenss evergreen of Yuletide redemption, which opened Wednesday at the Lyceum Theater.

title: Review: Einsteins Dreams, Adapted and Muddled in a New Musical
description: Do you remember the Alan Lightman novel Einsteins Dreams? It was such an odd little volume to hit the best-seller list, back in the early 1990s: a playful thought experiment about the nature of time, told in vivid episodes imagined by a young Albert Einsteins slumbering brain.

title: Tulsi Gabbard Criticizes Democrats in Democratic Debate, and Kamala Harris Fires Back
description: Representative Tulsi Gabbard of Hawaii offered a striking critique of the Democratic Party on Wednesday from a stage of 10 people vying to be the Democratic nominee for president, accusing the party of being too beholden to the foreign policy establishment in Washington.

title: Fact-Checking the November Democratic Debate
description: Ten candidates vying for the 2020 Democratic presidential nomination took the debate stage Wednesday night in Atlanta for the fifth round of debates.

title: Women Are Held to a Higher Standard, Klobuchar Says at Debate
description: Senator Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota was asked at Wednesday nights Democratic debate about her recent comment that she and the other women running for president would not be onstage if they had as little political experience as Mayor Pete Buttigieg of South Bend, Ind.

title: Underground Warning
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  We last saw Aimee Lucido in May, but before that, there was a seven-year gap between her crossword puzzles in The New York Times. In that time, Ms. Lucido worked in software development, got married, wrote a book called Emmy in the Key of Code and decided to embark on a full-time career as an author.

title: Border Patrol Agent Who Hit Migrant With Truck Is Sentenced to Probation
description: TUCSON, Ariz.  A former Border Patrol agent who hit a fleeing Guatemalan migrant with his truck in 2017  and who, more than two weeks before the encounter, referred to immigrants in a text message as subhuman and mindless murdering savages  was sentenced on Wednesday to three years of probation.

title: Quotation of the Day: Sondland Names Top Officials in Ukraine Push
description: Everyone was in the loop. It was no secret.

title: No, That Mac Factory in Texas Is Not New
description: President Trump on Wednesday toured a Texas plant that makes high-end Apple computers, chatting with Apples chief executive, Timothy D. Cook, and accepting a plate with the words Assembled in USA.

title: Cory Booker Jokes Biden Might Have Been High When He Made Marijuana Comments
description: Senator Cory Booker, in an attempt to illustrate how some candidates were not campaigning with true attention to the black community, turned his criticism on Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. for saying he did not support legalizing marijuana. During the Democratic primary debate in Atlanta on Wednesday, he joked that Mr. Biden might have been high when he said that.

title: Buttigieg Was a Target. But No One Was Attacked Like Warren.
description: Although the Democratic primary debate began with a series of questions about impeaching President Trump, allowing the candidates to take shots at the Republican rival they all hope to face in the general election, it swiftly transformed into a referendum on another politician who has increasingly presented a challenge to the Democratic Party: Senator Elizabeth Warren.

title: Watch: Key Moments From November Democratic Debate
description: Ten presidential candidates took the stage in Atlanta to discuss topics including impeachment, climate change and foreign policy. Also, there were some jokes.

title: The Electability Debate, Brought to You by the People Who Want to Be Elected
description: Pete Buttigieg was trying a little tenderness.

title: Free Internet Is Proposed in Britain. Is It Even Possible?
description: LONDON  In an election where Britains looming exit from the European Union has hung over the campaign, a debate about internet speeds would seem unlikely to enter the race.

title: Fiona Hill Viewed Serving Trump as Risky. Now Shes an Impeachment Witness.
description: Follow our live coverage of David Holmes and Fiona Hill testifying in the impeachment hearings.

title: Watch Kamala Harris Criticize Politicians for Taking Black Women for Granted
description: Senator Kamala Harris of California criticized some of her opponents at the debate on Wednesday night for their attitudes toward black women, saying they praised black women for consistently supporting Democratic candidates but took their votes for granted.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Impeachment, Prince Andrew, Tesla
description: The American ambassador to the E.U. delivered blunt testimony that implicated President Trump and top U.S. officials  including the vice president, the secretary of state, the acting chief of staff and others  in the pressure campaign on Ukraine.

title: Whats on TV Thursday: Philharmonia and Vanessa Hudgens
description: PHILHARMONIA Stream on Topic. Common: A thriller that uses classical music to ramp up tension. Less common: A thriller whose plot revolves around classical music. But both of those attributes apply to this French series, about a fictional Paris orchestra. It begins with the orchestras conductor dropping dead midconcert. His replacement, Hlne (Marie-Sophie Ferdane), is a hot shot with a mysterious past who flies from New York to Paris with a handgun in her luggage. The drama begins when Hlne starts making radical changes at the orchestra, like replacing the lead violinist with a young protge. What follows is a tense story that involves sex, blood and Vivaldi. It will debut in North America on Thursday on a revamped version of the website and streaming platform Topic, alongside the Italian mystery series THE MIRACLE. That show, created by the author Niccol Ammaniti, centers on the discovery of a statue of the Virgin Mary that weeps blood.

title: What to Watch For in Day 5 of the Trump Impeachment Hearings
description: The final House impeachment hearing of the week gets underway Thursday morning with joint testimony by Fiona Hill, a former Europe and Russia expert at the White House, and David Holmes, an embassy official in Kyiv.

title: Judge Blocks Scheduled Executions of Federal Death Row Inmates
description: WASHINGTON  A federal judge on Wednesday halted the executions of four federal prisoners that were scheduled to begin next month, essentially stymieing the Trump administrations plan to resume the use of the death penalty.

title: Afghanistans Curse: A Bomb From 2 Wars Ago Crushes a Family Today
description: DAHANA-E-AHANGARAN, Afghanistan  The three boys were buried on the southern face of the mountain in May. The side-by-side graves of the brothers Amir Khan and Liaqat are marked with a green flag. Mujtabas grave is covered in a rocky mound and light from the morning sun.

title: Word + Quiz: parsimonious
Late Night Is Tickled by Gordon Sondlands Impeachment Testimony
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. If youre interested in hearing from The Times regularly about great TV, sign up for our Watching newsletter and get recommendations straight to your inbox.

title: Calendar
description: What story does this illustration inspire for you?

title: Texans Look for Stability Against Wildly Unpredictable Colts
description: The rest of Week 12s matchups will be published on Friday.

title: There are Eight Undefeated Pac-12 Basketball Teams. Really.
description: The Pac-12 Conference is off to a quick start in its bid to turn around its disappointing showing the past two seasons in mens college basketball, positioning itself for more teams and potentially more wins in the 2020 N.C.A.A. tournament.

title: Henry Paulson Sounds Alarm: U.S.-China Relations May Only Get Worse
description: The United States and China will eventually settle their differences over tariffs  maybe even reach a deal that allows both sides to say they won.

title: Lesson of the Day: 114,000 Students in N.Y.C. Are Homeless. These Two Let Us Into Their Lives.
description: Featured Article: 114,000 Students in N.Y.C. Are Homeless. These Two Let Us Into Their Lives.

title: Literary Classics, Cut Down to Size
description: BERLIN  Loose, baggy monsters is how Henry James famously described the long and unruly novels of the 19th century. In Berlin this season, several new productions take on sprawling literary works, trimming them to manageable lengths while still capturing the thrill of their vast, imaginary universes.

title: Judge John Hodgman on Bar Trivia Etiquette
description: Zach writes: My friends and I play bar trivia every week. If someone on our team is absolutely sure of an answer, they can say, Ill die on this hill, and we have to submit that answer, no matter what. I believe that this rule can be overturned if everyone in the group knows this person is wrong. My friend Nick contends that this renders the original rule useless.

title: How to Give Away Your Trust Fund
description: First you need to figure out: What do I actually have? How much can I access? says Willa Conway, who is 31, currently has $3 million at her disposal and will eventually inherit millions more from a sand-mining fortune. Dont ignore a feeling that you have more than you need. When Conway was in her mid-20s, a graduate-school adviser told her about Resource Generation, which helps the young and wealthy redistribute their wealth. At a four-day retreat Conway attended, a presenter said, Give your money to social-justice organizing led by people most impacted by oppression. After Michael Brown Jr. was shot by the police in Ferguson, Mo., Conway helped lead a campaign that raised $1.4 million for more than 100 organizing groups led by African-Americans.

title: Queen & Slim Could Be One of the Great Love Stories of All Time  if You Let It
description: The person I love and I were among the first members of the public to see the new film Queen & Slim. Early in September, we watched it alone on an upper floor of a nondescript office building in downtown San Francisco. It was a phenomenally isolating experience. We sat in a screening room accompanied by two affable white P.R. people and a black security guard who said nothing. The room was otherwise empty. It was 11 a.m.

title: Winners and Losers of the Democratic Debate
description: Our columnists and contributors give their rankings.

title: Three Students, $3,000 and a Dream: An Affordable Brooklyn Apartment. Where Did They Wind Up?
description: Two N.Y.U. seniors and a recent graduate joined forces to look for a Brooklyn home that wasnt too tiny, too dingy or too sketchy. Heres what they found.

title: Dont Hate Kevin Wilson, but He Wrote His Best Seller in 10 Days
description: MAN ON FIRE Kevin Wilson writes in concentrated bursts. Hes published five books  his latest novel, Nothing to See Here, appears on this weeks hardcover fiction list at No. 15  but somehow he manages to spend most of his time with his sons, who are 11 and 7. He says, My wife is a writer too and a couple times a year, one of us will stay home with the kids for 10 days while the other rents a cabin or does a residency.

title: Tragicomic Fiction That Masquerades as an Extended Lawyer Joke
description: THE MUTATIONSBy Jorge ComensalTranslated by Charlotte Whittle

title: Phoebe Waller-Bridge Loves Antiheroines. Of Course.
description: I prefer not to know exactly how I feel about a character, says the Emmy-winning actor, writer and producer (whose new book is Fleabag: The Scriptures). I definitely started walking like a badass while reading Lisbeth Salander.

title: How to Get Your Running in During the Holidays
description: Whether your holidays are merry and bright or the time of year that you grit your teeth to get through, if you are a regular runner, youre probably going to want to run.

title: Do You Need Expert Advice on Being a Grandparent?
description: The first grandparent to arrive, Rohna Paskow, had taken the train from suburban Philadelphia. She saved seats for her daughter-in-laws parents, Charles and Michele Buchbauer, who were driving 50 miles from rural New Jersey to join her.

title: Susan Sontags Mind Games
description: The 1969 New York Film Festival was the first to feature four movies directed by women and three made in Swedish. Susan Sontags Duet for Cannibals, which she wrote and directed, fit both categories. Given the chance to make her debut film in the land of the reigning cinematic genius Ingmar Bergman, Sontag seized the opportunity to direct in a foreign language while supplying her own English subtitles. In those days her name was synonymous with zeitgeist.

title: Poem: La Migra
description: In his elegant third collection of poems, This American Autopsy, Jos Antonio Rodrguez examines what it means to be on the edge, between nationalities, acceptances and dismissals by la migra  immigration agents. When did anxiety become a birthright for whole groups of people? From the very beginning? How has a country made of immigrants come to this current moment of walls and detention facilities? His poems are humanizing testaments of life, penetrating headlines, inviting readers into real rooms and families. Selected by Naomi Shihab Nye

title: Are Public Impeachment Hearings Working?
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device:

title: Typing These Two Letters Will Scare Your Young Co-Workers
description: Send questions about the office, money, careers and work-life balance to workfriend@nytimes.com. Include your name and location, even if you want them withheld. Letters may be edited.

title: Is Racial and Economic Diversity in Schools Important?
description: Do you think that diversity in the classroom is important? Do you think there are learning or social benefits to being in a diverse school?

title: Shooting the Mafia Review: Crime Through a Watchful Lens
description: In the United States, too many people reflexively associate the murderous Italian-born crime entity called the Mafia with the pop culture products it inspires. But for the common people of Sicily, and its capital, Palermo, the Mafia has been a long-term waking nightmare, yielding incredibly high murder rates and viral, nearly all-encompassing corruption.

title: A London Warehouse District Hopes to Keep Its Edge
description: LONDON  Hackney Wick seems one of the few areas of London thats still on the cusp of gentrification. Around the corner from the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, its benefiting from upgrades tied to the 2012 Olympics and has become a hipster haunt brimming with bars, breweries and a smattering of shops.

title: $26 Million in Missing Paychecks, One Mysterious Swindler Charged
description: Nicole Ingram was at the supermarket when she got a confusing text. Her payroll check for working as a nursing assistant in New Jersey, which had been deposited into her account, was being withdrawn.

title: A Visit to the Head Spa
description: I dont believe there is such a thing as a bad facial or a bad massage.

title: Aaron Rodgers Is Still Fluent in Winning
description: GREEN BAY, Wis.  Aaron Rodgers paused.

title: Where Cars Try to Hit Mach 1, the Salt of the Earth Is Crumbling
description: Not even 30 years after Karl Benz built what is said to be the first automobile, Teddy Tetzlaff climbed into a Blitzen Benz racecar and blasted across the snow-white surface of the Bonneville Salt Flats in Utah, clocking in at 142.8 miles per hour and setting an unofficial land-speed record.

title: Who Won the Democratic Debate? Campaign Experts Weighed In
description: Twitter cant tell us whether, or how, Wednesdays MSNBC/Washington Post debate will change voters minds. But it can give us the perspectives of some of the people with expertise on primary races: veteran campaign strategists, consultants and advocates from both parties.

title: The Travel Industrys New Fix for Jet Lag
description: If I had to fly standing on my head to avoid the jet lag unleashed by 13 time zone changes, I would have. Instead, while everyone else dined on the night flight to Singapore, I sat in the dark, and, after we arrived, rotated like a sundial around a south-facing office window.

title: Leading AARP, With No Plans to Retire
description: Jo Ann Jenkins could have called it quits. She had worked in various posts in the federal government long enough to qualify for retirement, and she would have enjoyed a comfortable life unencumbered by a day job.

title: Like Restaurants, Buildings Will Get Grades (Ds for Energy Guzzlers)
description: New Yorkers are used to seeing letter grades on restaurants and bagel shops. Soon offices and residential buildings will be getting something similar.

title: A Wet Year Causes Farm Woes Far Beyond the Floodplains
description: The damage from the destructive spring flooding in the Midwest has been followed in parts of the country by a miserable autumn that is making a bad farming year worse, with effects that could be felt into next spring.

title: He Wanted to Be a Pro Basketball Player. He Became a Teacher Instead.
description: This article is part of a continuing series on Visionaries. The New York Times selected people from all over the world who are pushing the boundaries of their fields, from science and technology to culture and sports.

title: As Rents Outrun Pay, California Families Live on a Knifes Edge
description: [Sign up for our daily newsletter about news from California here.]

title: Republicans Seek to Muddy Impeachment Evidence as Their Defense of Trump
description: WASHINGTON  Republicans mounted an array of defenses of President Trump at this weeks impeachment hearings  making arguments that at times seemed to conflict with one another logically, but that dovetailed in a key way: All served to undermine Democrats allegations that Mr. Trump abused his power.

title: 36 Hours in Belgrade
description: While tourists are flooding European cities like Barcelona, Venice and Dubrovnik, the Serbian capital is quietly molding itself into a very fun and accommodating Balkan metropolis. Chefs are getting creative with Serbian cuisine and the cocktail bar scene has taken off, much to the delight of sophisticated locals. The National Museum and the Museum of Contemporary Art have just reopened after unexpectedly long renovations. Now the residents of the former capital of Yugoslavia are just waiting for the world to make a beeline to this affordable, friendly city with so much to offer.

title: Voodoo Is Part of Us
description: In a dark club in Downtown Brooklyn, surrounded by more than 100 people, Agathina Ginoue Nozy took a sip of Haitian rum. She stood near an altar stacked with skulls, lit candles, cigars, rum, coffee and bowls filled with charred salt fish, boiled plantains, cassava and piman (spicy peppers).

title: Is There Anything We Can All Agree On? Yes: Dolly Parton
description: Maybe youve heard the rumor about the tattoos.

title: At Odds With Labour, Britains Jews Are Feeling Politically Homeless
description: LONDON  At a synagogue west of London, a rabbi made an astonishing plea: Vote against the Labour Party in the coming general election, he urged his congregants, because its leader, Jeremy Corbyn, poses a danger to Jewish life as we know it.

title: Democratic Debate, Prince Andrew, National Book Awards: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Is N.Y.C. Ready for a Ban on Free Street Parking?
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: One of Worlds First Printed Christmas Cards Goes on Display
description: LONDON  For many, Christmas would not be the same without a house brimming with cards from their nearest and dearest, stamped and sent by mail or hand-delivered in the heart of the season.

title: An Unexpected, Yet Precisely Perfect Pairing
description: The old maxim that you dont really know a person until you live with him does not apply to Andrew Shackett and Patrick OKeefe. In their case, all they had to do to really get to know each other was hop on a plane from New York to Birmingham, England.

title: One Thing Trump Gets Right
description: In this weeks Mideast news, the Iranian regime has reportedly killed more than 100 of its own people as it attempts to suppress another wave of nationwide demonstrations. The Islamic State is taking advantage of Turkeys invasion of northern Syria to regroup. Governments in Lebanon and Iraq remain paralyzed by popular discontent. And Israel has struck dozens of targets near Damascus after intercepting Iranian rockets fired from Syria.

title: The Left Shouldnt Freak Out About Trumps Judges (Yet)
description: Republicans are celebrating how theyve packed the 12 regional federal appeals courts (excluding a specialized federal appellate court) with conservative judges. Earlier this month, President Trump hosted Senate Republicans at the White House to cheer their 45th confirmation. Stephen Bannon recently said, in praising Don McGahn, the former White House counsel who chose many of the new appointees, Why the left is triggered by Trump is because they understand theyre in a Kafkaesque nightmare, that Donald Trump is going to be in their personal lives 10, 20 and 30 years from now.

title: Debating in Georgia, Democrats Make Their Case on Voting Rights
description: The fifth Democratic debate in Atlanta brought the spotlight of the presidential primary to Georgia, a state plagued by rampant accusations of voter suppression and unfairly aggressive voter registration purges.

title: Can the Supreme Court Save Itself?
description: Im often asked these days whether there is anything the Supreme Court can do to extract itself from the partisan trap into which the rancid confirmation process and the courts own behavior have driven it. Its a hard question because, of course, individual justices have deeply held views that happen for the most part to map onto the views of the presidents who named them to their seats.

title: To Take on the Religious Right, We Need a Religious Left
description: I remember the first time I encountered God.

title: We Followed the Presidents Orders
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: Via Apple Podcasts | Via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Trumps Bizarre Apple Factory Visit
description: Charles Schwab is reportedly in talks to buy TD Ameritrade in a $26 billion deal that could be announced as early as today. (Want this by email? Sign up here.)

title: 21 Bridges Review: Catch Us if You Can
description: Hedging its bets, the manhunt movie 21 Bridges both flatters and reviles the police. On the one hand, its somber hero, a remorseless homicide detective named Davis (Chadwick Boseman), is the closest thing the N.Y.P.D. has to a perp whisperer. On the other, Davis manages to shoot almost one suspect a month. Unapologetic about his kill rate, he explains to Internal Affairs that they all deserved their fates, so lets move on, shall we?

title: Hala Review: Girl, Disrupted
description: The title character of Hala  a Pakistani-American teenager in her final year of high school  is cautious with her words, but avidly curious with her eyes and ears. Floating in a limbo between two cultures, shes gently pulling back from her Muslim faith and tentatively testing her crush on Jesse (Jack Kilmer), a tousled blond classmate with a sensitive soul. Shes a fascinating paradox, at once subdued and adventurous: One moment, shes meekly enduring the affectionate nagging of her anxious mother (Purbi Joshi); the next, shes racing through their Chicago suburb on her skateboard. Right away, we want to know her better.

title: Debate Night: The On Politics Breakdown
description: Hi, and welcome to a special post-debate edition of On Politics. Im Lisa Lerer, your host.

title: The Courier Review: Gary Oldman Plays Bad. The Movie Plays Worse.
description: In this unfortunate action thriller, Gary Oldman plays an eye-patch-sporting baddie named Mannings. In a church where hes about to be arrested, he says to his daughter, There are several things that need to be done very quickly so that everything is in order.

title: Mr. Toilet Review: Getting a Handle on the Worlds Toilet Shortage
description: A film called Mr. Toilet: The Worlds #2 Man had better be prepared to tank at the box office. At minimum, concession sales at any theater showing Lily Zepedas documentary are bound to take a plunge.

title: Key Moments From Hill and Holmess Testimony in the Impeachment Inquiry
description: Fiona Hill, the former top Russia expert on the National Security Council, said President Trumps demands for Ukraine to announce investigations into former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and the 2016 elections amounted to a domestic political errand that diverged from American foreign policy goals.

title: Donald Trump Got Punked: The Best One-Liners From the Debate
description: From Cory Bookers buzzkill response to Joseph R. Biden Jr.s stance on marijuana legalization to Andrew Yangs intended message for Vladimir V. Putin, the candidates sharp wit was on display in between discussions on policy and politics.

title: What Were the Most Memorable Moments From Last Nights Debate?
description: At their best, they were clever and unscripted. A timely comeback. A witty one-liner.

title: Rodrigo Duterte Calls for Ban on Public Vaping in the Philippines
description: MANILA  President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines has ordered a sweeping ban on vaping in public, threatening to use the police and military to enforce what observers in the country have called a draconian order.

title: Kawhi Leonard. Paul George. Same Court. Same Time.
description: LOS ANGELES  It rained in Los Angeles on Wednesday, one of those infrequent meteorological events that seem to transfix this city while paralyzing the traffic. At around the same time, the Clippers went through their morning shootaround ahead of their game against the Boston Celtics later that night.

title: Extinction Rebellion Co-Founder Apologizes for Holocaust Remarks
description: LONDON  A founder of the climate activism group Extinction Rebellion apologized on Thursday for the crass words he used to describe the Holocaust as an almost normal event and just another ugly episode in human history.

title: Warren, Sanders, Klobuchar and Booker Talk Abortion Rights at Debate
description: With states passing near-total bans on abortion and a conservative Supreme Court majority poised to potentially revisit Roe v. Wade, reproductive rights have become a major issue in the 2020 campaign. Some candidates and abortion-rights advocates, however, have noted the relative lack of questions on the issue in the Democratic presidential debates so far.

title: Who Is David Holmes, the U.S. Embassy Official Who Testified on Thursday?
description: [Catch up on key moments from Fiona Hills and David Holmess testimony on Thursday.]

title: Tulsi Gabbards White Pantsuit Isnt Winning
description: What has happened to the white pantsuit? Watching the Democratic debate held in Atlanta on Wednesday night, it was one of the questions that stuck with me. Its not as important as Medicare for All, obviously, or economic disparity. But given the role white pantsuits have played in the national conversation for the last three years, its not immaterial. (No pun intended.)

title: No Joy in Victory in a Football Game Interrupted by a Young Boys Shooting
description: PHILADELPHIA  In a record year for gun violence at high school sporting events, DaVion Harper played a football game Wednesday with a somber tribute written on the shirt beneath his jersey: R.I.P. Micah. Beneath his helmet, Harper drew the number 10 on one cheek and a cross on the other.

title: Full Analysis of Trump Impeachment Hearings, Day 5
description: Fiona Hill, the former top Russia expert on the National Security Council, and David Holmes, an aide in the United States Embassy in Kyiv, testified Thursday before the House Intelligence Committee.

title: Read Fiona Hills Opening Statement
description: Ms. Hill had a front-row seat to dramatic events in the White House around the pressure campaign on Ukraine.

title: Trump Reverses Navy Decision to Oust Edward Gallagher From SEALs
description: Anyone in the Navy can spot a SEAL by the gold insignia pinned to his chest: an eagle on an anchor, clutching a flintlock pistol and a trident. It is the badge of an elite band of warriors, one of the most revered in the military.

title: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood Review: You Are My Friend
description: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood celebrates the virtues of patient listening, gentleness and the honest expression of feelings. Its about how a man who has devoted his life to being kind helps a man with a professional investment in skepticism to become a little nicer. The appeal of such a movie at the present moment is obvious enough, and so perhaps are the risks. This modest, quiet story  based on a magazine article published more than 20 years ago  could easily have turned into something preachy, sentimental and overstated.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks properties include a six-bedroom in Moorestown, N.J., and a four-bedroom in Jericho, N.Y.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn, on the Grand Concourse in the Bronx, and in Hells Kitchen.

description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties:

title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn, Manhattan and the Bronx
