title: More Than 140 Nazca Lines Are Discovered in Peruvian Desert
description: A huge carving of a monkey with its tail twirled in a spiral; vast, geometric images of a condor and a hummingbird; an immense spider  the 2,000-year-old Nazca Lines in Peru have awed and mystified modern viewers since they were first seen from the air last century.

title: What Do Californians Think of the Candidates?
description: Good morning.

title: The Most Popular Properties of October
description: The most viewed listings on The New York Timess Find a Home site in October included Manhattan apartments, a sprawling estate in Kansas, and a weather-resistant, high-tech home on the coast of Nova Scotia.

title: Retirement Home Told a Nun She Couldnt Wear Religious Attire
description: PARIS  A Catholic nun who was told she could stay in a retirement home in France only if she stopped wearing religious clothing was wronged, French officials say, in a case that they say misinterpreted the countrys laws prohibiting religious attire in some public spaces.

title: Frozen 2 Review: The Cold Still Never Bothers Them
description: Let It Go, the warble heard around the world, wasnt just the signature song from Frozen. It was an anthem (Here I stand!) for the mighty, mighty girl power that helped push Disney into industry dominance. The companys supremacy is often pinned on its highest profile franchises: Lucasfilm, Marvel and Pixar, which have historically featured male-driven stories. But Disney has also heavily profited from a sparkly pink world of adventure and aspirational uplift for spirited girls and women who dream big, to borrow a motto from its princess franchise.

title: Who Is Julia Sweeney Coming to Terms With? Its Pat
description: In her current one-woman show, Julia Sweeney shares the story of how she acquainted her teenage daughter with her most famous Saturday Night Live character, an adenoidal social misfit of uncertain gender named Pat.

title: Broadways Michael Jackson: Aint Too Proud Star Ephraim Sykes
description: The Michael Jackson musical has found its King of Pop.

title: A Palatial Apartment for an Arts Patron
description: The 7,000-square-foot home of Jayne Wrightsman goes on the market.

title: The Fifth Avenue Home of Jayne Wrightsman Goes on the Market
description: The palatial Upper East Side home of Jayne Wrightsman, a celebrated arts benefactor and grande dame of New Yorks high society, is now up for sale, seven months after her death at age 99.

title: 16-Year-Old Scooter Rider Killed by Tow Truck in New Jersey
description: A 16-year-old boy became the first person killed while riding a shared electric scooter in New Jersey when he collided with a tow truck in Elizabeth on Wednesday night.

title: Prince Andrews Friendship With Epstein Joins a List of Royal Scandals
description: LONDON The British monarchy has survived public crises before  religious schisms, revolutions, murderous kings  but this week the royal family scrambled to confront a relatively new opponent: the embarrassing televised interview.

title: Pence Is Implicated
description: This article is part of David Leonhardts newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it each weekday.

title: Can Our Lease Weather Unrequited Love?
description: My best friend (a gay man) confessed to our roommate (a straight man) that hes been madly in love with him for two years and always will be. I expected this to ruin their relationship. But after our roommate explained that he wasnt interested, everything was fine  until recently. My BFF began pushing boundaries. Last night, for instance, he jumped into our roommates bed and begged to sleep with him. Our roommate asked him nicely to leave, but finally had to yell at him. Ive advised my BFF to move on to available men, but he wont (and says he cant). Help! There are two years left on our lease.

title: Were Still Talking About Gauguin
description: THE GAUGUIN ATLAS By Nienke Denekamp Translated by Laura Watkinson

title: When Drinks Is the Only Box Left Unchecked
description: This Thanksgiving you are organized. Youve got checklists and spreadsheets. Nobody can say you have left things until its too late.

title: Read David Holmess Opening Statement
description: The career diplomat said he was told President Trump cared more about investigating his political rivals than about the welfare of Ukraine.

title: Thank God for Judy Blume
description: When I share information in my gynecology and obstetrics practice and on social media, one of the most common responses I get from women is, How did I not know that?

title: The Last Time America Turned Away From the World
description: One hundred years ago, on Nov. 19, 1919, Alice Roosevelt Longworth threw a late-night party. Longworth, the daughter of Theodore Roosevelt and wife of Nicholas Longworth, the future speaker of the House, was celebrating the defeat in the Senate that day of the Treaty of Versailles, which encapsulated President Woodrow Wilsons grand project for world peace, the League of Nations. We were jubilant, she recalled later, too elated to mind the reservationists. And by we, I mean the irreconcilables, who were against any League, no matter how safeguarded with reservations.

title: Why Were Impeaching Our Student Body President Over Trump Jr.
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla.  On Oct. 10, Donald Trump Jr. and the former Fox News host Kimberly Guilfoyle gave a speech at the University of Florida for $50,000 at the invitation of our student body president, Michael Murphy. Students protested, and normally that would have been the end of the story.

title: Undoing Trumps Syria Blunder
description: According to a report released on Tuesday by the Department of Defense inspector general, President Trumps withdrawal from Syria has allowed ISIS to reconstitute capabilities and resources within Syria and strengthen its ability to plan attacks abroad.

title: Pete Buttigieg Is in Bad Shape With Black Democrats. Heres Why.
description: Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. has 154 endorsements from current or former black or Hispanic elected officials. Senator Kamala Harris has 93. Senator Bernie Sanders has 91. Senator Cory Booker has 50. Senator Elizabeth Warren has 43.

title: Good Leaders Make Good Doctors
description: During our final year of medical training, I would take turns with the other senior residents responding to cardiac arrests in the hospital. Wed spend weeks camped out in the doctors lounge, our hearts racing at the prospect of a patients heart stopping, bracing for the moment a shrill pager or overhead speaker would signal an emergency.

title: In Chelsea, a Little Piece of Prerevolutionary Iran
description: Jojo Anavim may be a contemporary pop artist himself, but he says that his personal art collection is informed mostly by his Persian-Jewish roots. His parents, Immanouel and Ladan Anavim, both fled Iran before the countrys 1979 revolution  a time when Jews were among those facing persecution  and settled on Long Island.

title: After Trauma, a Silenced Vocalist Sings Again
description: In the fall of 2013, the vocalist Lucy Dhegrae performed a solo called Dithyramb. The five-minute piece, written by Jason Eckardt, consists of cries, truncated syllables and sharp sibilant sounds that appear to resemble someone angrily shushing herself.

title: A Dance That Stops 2 of Neptunes Moons From Colliding
description: Neptune is the loneliest planet in the solar system. The ice giant, orbiting the sun at a distance of 2.8 billion miles, is the only planet that cannot be seen by the naked eye. Along with Uranus, we have only paid it a single visit, back when Voyager 2 zipped by in the late-1980s.

title: WeWork Will Lay Off 2,400 Workers
description: WeWork said on Thursday that it was laying off 2,400 employees around the world, weeks after huge losses at the co-working company brought it close to financial collapse.

title: Israels Netanyahu Indicted on Charges of Fraud, Bribery and Breach of Trust
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was indicted Thursday on charges of bribery, fraud and breach of trust in a set of long-running corruption cases, throwing his political future into doubt and heightening the uncertainty and chaos surrounding Israels fitful, yearlong struggle to choose its next leader.

title: A Former Fox News Executive Divides Americans Using Russian Tactics
description: SAN FRANCISCO  At first glance, the websites Conservative Edition News and Liberal Edition News have only one thing in common: Both have been carefully curated to inflame Americas culture wars.

title: Early Menopause Increases Heart Risks
description: Early menopause, before age 40, may increase the risk for cardiovascular disease.

title: Filipino, Both Classic and Modern
description: Kusina Pinoy Bistro in Woodside, Queens, focuses on the same homey fare found throughout Little Manila, but is also attuned to newer developments in Filipino cooking.

title: At Kusina Pinoy Bistro, Eating Is a Messy, Happy Business
description: You can see the calamares gigantes coming from across the room, tall and swaying, a fountaining of deep-fried squid. A skewer, planted vertically, holds it all upright, with the tentacles massed at the top, curling upward and suggesting a wild-haired puppet.

title: Trump Impeachment Hearings: Day 5 Highlights
description: Fiona Hill, the former top Russia expert on the National Security Council, and David Holmes, an aide at the United States Embassy in Kyiv, testified before the House Intelligence Committee.

title: Thinning Hair All Over
description: Does every woman lose their pubic hair with age? Why doesnt the medical profession tell us these things upfront? When did women wear merkins, and how did they stay on?

title: Charlotte Perriand, Stepping Out of Corbusiers Shadow
description: PARIS  It was 1927, and Le Corbusier had already declared, The house is a machine for living in. But like Charlie Chaplin in Modern Times, he hadnt quite figured out how to live with the machine from a practical, everyday point of view in the living room, for example, or the bedroom. Yes, the machine was the messiah of the new Modernism, but how do you sit on one? How do you sleep and eat on it? Just how do you furnish modernity?

title: What Weve Learned From Hills and Holmess Impeachment Testimonies
description: WASHINGTON  David Holmes, a career diplomat and political counselor to the United States Embassy in Ukraine, and Fiona Hill, a former Europe and Russia expert at the White House, schooled lawmakers on Thursday on the United States geopolitical relationship with Ukraine and provided some new details about the efforts to pressure Ukraine to announce investigations into President Trumps political rivals.

title: Review: A Fearless, Barefoot Pianist Makes a Carnegie Debut
description: Many have long begged for classical music to loosen up the dress codes for its performers. The pianist Conrad Tao must have taken this to heart on Wednesday at Weill Recital Hall: He wore black slacks and a black T-shirt  sometimes with a black jacket, sometimes not  and, most unusual, went barefoot.

title: 2 Die During Training Exercise at Air Force Base in Oklahoma
description: Two airmen were killed during a training exercise on Thursday at Vance Air Force Base in Oklahoma, according to military officials.

title: Varda by Agns Review: A Final Visit With an Irreplaceable Filmmaker
description: Admirers of Agns Varda, who died in March at 90, may be looking for a fitting remembrance. Especially in the last two decades of her long career, she was an unusually and deeply companionable filmmaker. Her death feels like the loss of a friend, even to people who never met her. At the same time, those who are unfamiliar with and curious about Vardas work may be wondering where to begin. With characteristic generosity, her final film, Varda by Agns, answers both needs. Its a perfect introduction and a lovely valediction.

title: Senate Approves Spending Bill to Avoid Shutdown, and Trump Signs It
description: WASHINGTON  Congress gave final approval on Thursday to a stopgap spending bill that would punt the threat of a government shutdown to just before Christmas, setting up a potential clash over federal spending just as the House could be weighing whether to impeach President Trump.

title: Flavored E-Cigarettes and Public Health
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: Six Dancing Eccentrics in Search of Some Seriousness
description: As is fitting for a show with an address for a title, the setting of 32 rue Vandenbranden is a definite place: a couple of trailer homes somewhere isolated and snowy. The characters, too, are distinctive: six eccentrics all up in one anothers business. But what to call the action? Mimed soap opera? Slapstick horror?

title: How a Death at a Caribbean Resort Became an International Incident
description: Two men fought in a desperate struggle last April inside a suite at a tropical resort in Anguilla, and only one of them would leave alive.

title: Labour Party Manifesto: Corbyn Plan Offers Radical Answers for the U.K.
description: LONDON  In a bid to re-energize his election campaign, Jeremy Corbyn, the leader of Britains Labour Party, unveiled the partys most left-wing agenda in a generation on Thursday, vowing to tax the wealthy to renationalize large parts of the countrys utilities and railways, reduce carbon emissions, and pay for better health care and schools.

title: Is Trump the Force for Change America Wanted?
description: To the Editor:

title: William Loren Katz, Historian of African-Americans, Dies at 92
description: The fountainhead of the historian Bill Katzs immersion in African-American culture was his fathers passion for jazz. Ben Katz had derived more pleasure from the music and its historical roots than from his day job as an art director for an advertising agency.

title: Film Club: I Was the Fastest Girl in America, Until I Joined Nike
description: Are female athletes held to unrealistic and unhealthy expectations and standards?

title: Marie Kondo Wants to Sell You Nice Things. Whats Wrong With That?
description: This week, The Wall Street Journal reported that Marie Kondo  the tidying guru, publishing juggernaut and former Shinto shrine maiden  had opened an online store. The response, predictably, has been a collective: Wait, what?

title: What Students Are Saying About Marriage, Paying for School Lunch, and Saying No
description: Have you ever wondered what Generation Z thinks about marriage? Or how students feel about being publicly shamed by schools for not having lunch? Or teenagers advice for fellow teenagers on how to set healthy boundaries?

title: Bikram: Yogi, Guru, Predator Review: The Toxic Man behind Yogas Hottest Trend
description: The new Netflix documentary Bikram: Yogi, Guru, Predator is the Oscar-winning filmmaker Eva Orners portrait of the rise and fall of the yoga magnate Bikram Choudhury. The film first traces how Choudhury built his Bikram empire of hot yoga studios, training celebrities and amassing devotees as Americas favorite yogi. The narrative then turns to the accusations of sexual abuse that unmasked the sordid man behind the wellness phenomenon.

title: Whats Next for Netanyahu, and Israel?
description: The corruption charges brought against Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel on Thursday not only threaten his political future, they also present the country with an unprecedented legal quandary.

title: Dark Waters Review: The Killing Fields of West Virginia
description: Outrage mixes with despair in Dark Waters, an unsettling, slow-drip thriller about big business and the people who become its collateral damage. Its a fictional take on a true, ghastly story about a synthetic polymer that was discovered by a chemist at DuPont, which branded it Teflon.

title: Branko Lustig, 87, Dies; Holocaust Survivor Turned Film Producer
description: Nearly 50 years after his liberation from the Bergen-Belsen concentration camp, Branko Lustig stood onstage at the 1994 Academy Awards ceremony to accept an Oscar for best picture as one of three producers of Steven Spielbergs Schindlers List.

title: Watchdog Report on Russia Investigation to Come Out Next Month
description: WASHINGTON  A highly anticipated Justice Department inspector generals report on aspects of the Russia investigation, including its origins and whether the F.B.I. abused its surveillance powers, will be released early next month, according to a letter released on Thursday.

title: Elizabeth Warren Makes Pitch to Black Women In Speech About Racial Inequities
description: ATLANTA  One day after a televised debate featuring significant exchanges about race, Democratic presidential candidates fanned out across this capital of black political power to pitch their message to black voters and send a clear signal: Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. should not take support from African-Americans for granted.

title: Republicans Now Support a Form of Paid Leave. So Whats the Holdup?
description: Paid leave has long been a Democratic cause, one that candidates rallied around at the debate Wednesday night. Now its also one for Republicans, whove recently embraced a version of it, with a flurry of new bills and a White House summit next month. The debate revealed minor divisions in the candidates approaches; the bigger differences, though, are between the two parties.

title: The T List: What to See, Drink and Wear This Week
description: Welcome to the T List, a newsletter from the editors of T Magazine. Each week, were sharing things we are eating, wearing, listening to or coveting now. We hope youll join us for the ride. (Sign up here, if you havent already, and you can reach us at tlist@nytimes.com.)

title: Failing to Decipher Black Voters
description: There was quite a bit of talk about the black vote and the black community at Wednesday nights presidential debate.

title: Violin Stars Will Celebrate Isaac Stern at Tanglewood
description: A small string sections worth of violin stars will celebrate the centenary of the violinist Isaac Stern. Andris Nelsons will conduct the Boston Symphony Orchestra in the third act of Wagners Tannhuser. And Paul Lewis will play the five Beethoven piano concertos.

title: Dozens of Babies Died Because of U.K. Hospital Failings, Report Finds
description: LONDON  Dozens of babies and three mothers died at hospitals in England over four decades because of major staff failings, in what experts said could become the biggest maternity scandal in the history of Britains National Health Service.

title: $93.6 Million Verdict Threatens to Bankrupt One of Americas Most Powerful Unions
description: SEATTLE  For decades, the International Longshore and Warehouse Union has solidified its power with aggressive demonstrations of solidarity across its Pacific ports.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Officials in Beijing are furious over a U.S. bill compelling the government to support Hong Kong protesters. Passed by Congress this week, it awaits President Trumps signature.

title: Catherine Pugh, Former Baltimore Mayor, Pleads Guilty in Childrens Book Fraud
description: BALTIMORE  Catherine Pugh, the former mayor of Baltimore, who swept into office three years ago pledging to restore integrity in a city grappling with corruption, entrenched economic inequality and pervasive violence, pleaded guilty on Thursday to federal crimes tied to a childrens book series she wrote.

title: Changing the World, One Foster Kid at a Time
description: Bianca knows the foster care system inside and out. After growing up in it, she set her sights on changing it for the better.

title: Jim Meehan Has Left PDT, the Influential Bar He Helped Found
description: The bartender Jim Meehan, a pioneering figure in the craft-cocktail revival, is no longer involved in PDT, the acclaimed East Village speakeasy that he helped found 12 years ago. He confirmed this week that he was forced out of his position as a managing partner, as part of an organizational restructuring in March.

title: Whats Better Than Seeing a Hopper Painting? Sleeping in One
description: RICHMOND, Va.  Behind a pane of glass at the Virginia Museum of Fine Arts, a wooden bed frame anchors a sparsely decorated motel room. Vintage suitcases have been arranged at the foot of the bed, and light streams in diagonally through a window, just beyond which a green Buick is visible, parked in the foreground of a mesa landscape.

title: How Churches Fight the Stigma of H.I.V.
description: ATLANTA  The second Wednesday of the month is always crowded in the parking lot of Bible Way Ministries. Thats the day the church offers its community food bank  and as of this year, its also the day when an AIDS Healthcare Foundation mobile testing unit rolls up to provide H.I.V. testing to anyone who wants it.

title: Fiona Hill Testifies Fictions on Ukraine Pushed by Trump Help Russia
description: WASHINGTON  A former White House Russia expert on Thursday sharply denounced a fictional narrative embraced by President Trump and his Republican allies that Ukraine, not Russia, interfered in the 2016 election, testifying that the claim was a fabrication by Moscow that had harmed the United States.

title: N.F.L. Upholds Myles Garretts Indefinite Suspension
description: N.F.L. appeals officers on Thursday upheld the indefinite suspension for Cleveland Browns defensive end Myles Garrett for hitting Pittsburgh Steelers quarterback Mason Rudolph in the head with a helmet during a game last week.

title: At Chelsea, Hard Work as High Art
description: LONDON  For Andrea Pirlo, it was the satisfaction of a free kick, sweetly struck, sweeping a couple of centimeters over a defenders head, beyond the goalkeepers despairing reach, whistling into the corner of the goal. There could be, he wrote in his autobiography, no greater feeling in life.

title: An Adrenaline Junkies Dream Job
description: David was a machinist, and a very good one at that. But when his contract ended, he decided it was time for something new. Learn how he turned his passion for motorcycles into a career.

title: Teslas Electric Cybertruck Is Unveiled. Its Pointy.
description: Elon Musk on Thursday unveiled the Cybertruck, an electric pickup truck that Tesla hopes will rival Fords best-selling F-150 line.

title: Iran Declares Protests Are Over, but the Evidence Suggests Otherwise
description: The Iranian authorities moved Thursday to project the appearance of normalcy after a week of violent protests over gasoline price increases, partly restoring internet access and decreeing that the mayhem that convulsed the country was really a foreign-backed failure.

title: To Bring Clean Water to The World, Start Local
description: Over two-million Americans still dont have clean, running water. Learn how George McGraw and his team work to bring potable water into the households around the world.

title: Protect and Serve Our Four-Legged Friends
description: A journey through foster care left Karry certain that law enforcement was his future.

title: Tom Spurgeon, Who Surveyed the Comic Book World, Dies at 50
description: Tom Spurgeon, a reporter and editor who exerted broad influence in the world of comic books and graphic novels, covering it in books, blogs and a magazine, died on Nov. 13 at his home in Columbus, Ohio. He was 50.

title: 12 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: Sometimes we look to the past to help us better understand the present, and sometimes we look out of sheer rubbernecking fascination. (In literary terms, the references here are Faulkners The past is never dead and L. P. Hartleys The past is a foreign country, two quotes that live on in the hoary files of English composition instructors everywhere. Compare and contrast, please.)

title: When a Wrestler Becomes a Caregiver
description: A semi-pro wrestler and a caretaker of adults with disabilities. The two worlds of Nick Zoppo have a lot more in common than you might think.

title: Arabic-Language Version of Sesame Street Will Debut 3 New Muppets
description: The global Sesame Street family is getting three new Muppet members: Basma, Jad and Mazooza.

description: Our guide to dance performances happening this weekend and in the week ahead.

title: 20 Art Exhibitions to View in N.Y.C. This Weekend
description: Our guide to new art shows and some that will be closing soon.

title: 11 Plays and Musicals to Go to in N.Y.C. This Weekend
description: Our guide to plays and musicals coming to New York stages and a few last-chance picks of shows that are about to close. Our reviews of open shows are at nytimes.com/reviews/theater.

title: 4 Film Series to Catch in N.Y.C. This Weekend
description: Our guide to film series and special screenings happening this weekend and in the week ahead. All our movie reviews are at nytimes.com/reviews/movies.

description: Our guide to pop and rock shows and the best of live jazz happening this weekend and in the week ahead.

title: 6 Classical Music Concerts to See in N.Y.C. This Weekend
description: Our guide to the citys best classical music and opera happening this weekend and in the week ahead.

title: Seven Russians Suspended for Obstructing Doping Investigation in Track
description: The president of Russias track and field governing body was among seven people suspended on Thursday for obstructing an antidoping investigation, deepening a crisis for Russian sports that soon could see the country barred from next summers Tokyo Olympics and other major international sporting events.

title: After Deaths, Ban on Flavored Vapes to Be Passed by New York City
description: The New York City Council agreed on Thursday to ban flavored e-cigarettes amid heightened concerns about the use of such products, making New York City the most populous jurisdiction in the country to impose such a ban.

title: How They Suited Up for the Impeachment Battle
description: The fourth presidential impeachment hearings in the history of the United States, whose public phase came to an end on Thursday afternoon in the columned environs of the House Ways and Means Committee hearing room, may have hewed to decorum, but they were a battlefield nonetheless.

title: Trump and His Corrupt Old Party
description: Formally, the House of Representatives is holding an inquiry into the question of whether Donald J. Trump should be impeached. In reality, weve known the answer to that question for a long time. In a different era, when both parties believed in the Constitution, Trumps abuse of his position for personal gain would have led to his removal from office long ago.

title: Obama Urges Democrats to Chill Out About 2020 Presidential Field
description: LOS ALTOS HILLS, Calif.  Former President Barack Obama urged Democrats on Thursday to chill out about the partys 2020 field and to avoid putting candidates through purity tests, and warned that average voters were nervous about changes that might take away what little they have.

title: The Jim Crow South? No, Long Island Today
description: White Americans have long found comfort believing that racial discrimination is a thing of the past.

title: Supreme Court Urged to Allow Release of Trumps Financial Records
description: WASHINGTON  In a pair of filings on Thursday, a House committee and Manhattan prosecutors urged the Supreme Court to clear the way for disclosure of President Trumps financial records.

title: No Deal on NAFTA Successor, but Democrats Point to Progress
description: WASHINGTON  Democratic lawmakers left the capital for the Thanksgiving break on Thursday without a final agreement on President Trumps revised North American trade deal, prolonging a difficult negotiation with the administration on one of the presidents trade priorities.

title: Virus Outbreak Closes Colorado Schools for More Than 20,000 Students
description: When a virus appeared last week, a Colorado school district closed one high school in an attempt to stymie an outbreak. A few days later, a nearby middle school was closed. By Thursday, administrators were forced to close an entire school district that serves more than 22,000 students.

title: The Revolt Against Populism
description: Have you noticed that the world is on fire?

title: Wat Misaka, 95, First Nonwhite in Modern Pro Basketball, Dies
description: Wat Misaka, the son of Japanese immigrants, was a 5-foot-7 guard who starred for the University of Utah on teams that won two national tournament championships at Madison Square Garden in New York and then joined the Knicks there in 1947.

title: Edward Gallagher, the SEALs and Why the Trident Pin Matters
description: It is a ritual that has been repeated at many funerals of Navy SEALs and dramatized in Hollywood movies: SEALs approach a gravesite one by one, remove the gold-colored pin from the left breast of their dress uniforms and pound them into the coffin of a fallen comrade. The living mourn, with the primary symbol of their brotherhood missing, to be replaced only after the dead have been buried.

title: Campaigns Say Google Ad Policy Sidesteps Problem of Disinformation
description: Googles new restrictions on political advertising, following an outright ban on such ads by Twitter, amount to a one-two punch on 2020 campaigns: The online platforms are creating a big new headache for them, while failing to address a different problem they fear most.

title: Trumps Lose-Lose Proposition in Korea
description: President Trumps conviction that allies are getting American military protection at a bargain-basement price is well known. It is also dangerous, as his current tiff with South Korea demonstrates.

title: R.N.C. Spent Nearly $100,000 on Copies of Donald Trump Jr.s Book
description: When Donald Trump Jr.s new book Triggered appeared at the top of the New York Times best-seller list this month, a debate erupted over how and why it had claimed the No. 1 spot.

title: The Love-Hate Relationship Between Humans and Magpies
description: I thought it might be safe for me and my vulnerable head to go outside. But I wasnt sure. Swooping season for the Australian magpie might not be over yet.

title: Trump Awards the First Arts and Humanities Medals of His Presidency
description: WASHINGTON  In honoring the actor Jon Voight, an outspoken Trump supporter, with the National Medal of the Arts on Thursday, President Trump described him as somebody I happen to really like.

title: The Impeachment Hearings Revealed a Lot None of It Great for Trump
description: In his opening statement on Thursday, the last day of the scheduled public hearings in the Houses impeachment inquiry, Devin Nunes, the top Republican on the House Intelligence Committee, expressed his hope that todays hearing marks the merciful end of this spectacle in the impeachment committee.

title: White House Wont Say if Trump Will Sign Hong Kong Bill That Has Angered China
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has spent months delicately sidestepping Hong Kongs escalating battle between pro-democracy demonstrators and security services enforcing Chinas authoritarian government line.

title: Anticipating Impeachment, Republicans Debate Trial Timeline
description: WASHINGTON  The White House and the Republicans in the Senate, all but certain that the House will move forward to impeach President Trump, are divided over whether to embrace a lengthy trial that could give his allies a chance to mount an elaborate defense of his conduct before a polarized nation, or to move quickly to dispense with charges against him.

title: Impeachment Briefing: Highlights From the Hill Hearing
description: Two witnesses described their intimate views of an attempted quid pro quo on Thursday, wrapping up a momentous three-day stretch of public hearings. Heres a recap.

title: At Davis Cup, a Memorable Night (Plus Morning) Exposes Some Flaws
description: MADRID  Even for Spain, it was late, which is saying something in a nocturnal nation where a 10 p.m. dinner is nothing unusual.

title: The Impeachment Witnesses Not Heard
description: WASHINGTON  In recent days, lawmakers were told that when President Trump ramped up his campaign to pressure Ukraine into helping him against his domestic political rivals, he directed advisers to his personal lawyer. Talk with Rudy, he instructed. But one thing lawmakers will not do is talk with Rudy.

title: She Saved Us: Mourners Pay Tribute to Toni Morrison
description: More than 3,000 people gathered at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine on Thursday to celebrate Toni Morrison, a giant of American literature whose work won acclaim for its groundbreaking style and complex exploration of black American identity.

title: Shepard Smith, Former Fox News Anchor, Puts $500,000 Behind Free Press
description: In his first public remarks since abruptly resigning from Fox News last month, the anchor Shepard Smith called on Thursday for a steadfast defense of independent journalism, while offering a few subtle barbs at President Trumps treatment of the press.

title: They Toil Gladly Offstage. Impeachment Lands Them in the Spotlight.
description: WASHINGTON  They are, in a sense, the permanent, beating, bipartisan heart of the government of the United States.

title: Review: In The Underlying Chris, You Are Who You Were
description: Though I used to write cryptic puzzles for pin money, I dont think I ever wrote any as tricky and compelling as The Underlying Chris.

title: Trumps NOAA Pick, Barry Myers, Asks to Withdraw Nomination
description: Barry Lee Myers, whose nomination by President Trump to lead the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration remained unconfirmed by the Senate for more than two years, asked the White House this week to withdraw it, saying that surgery and chemotherapy made it impractical for him to serve.

title: Yes, Its O.K. to Be Sad During the Holidays
description: All I want for Christmas is a nap.

title: Smashing Good Times
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  This grid! So effervescent and refreshing  every other entry got a reaction, usually a chortle, once or twice a cringe (because of a personal association, I promise, no shade intended for the puzzle). Emily Carroll has ramped up production this year and is now one day of the week away from hitting for the cycle. That will be a Saturday, which gives us something to look forward to, especially after solving todays endeavor, which is Ms. Carrolls first Friday and first themeless puzzle for The Times.

title: Man Who Threatened 2 Members of Congress Sentenced to 5 Years in Prison
description: A western New York man convicted of leaving menacing phone messages for two Republican members of Congress was sentenced in federal court on Thursday to five years in prison, the second legal development in the region this week involving ominous phone calls to public officials.

title: Yale Womens Soccer Coach Leaves School Amid Allegations of Sexual Misconduct
description: The head coach of the Yale womens soccer team left the university this week after sexual misconduct allegations surfaced from when he coached at a nearby college in Connecticut a decade ago.

title: The World Burns All Year. Are There Enough Planes to Douse the Flames?
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Sharing the giant air tankers that fight fires 5,000 gallons of water at a time used to be simpler. Californias wildfires faded before Australias bush fires surged, leaving time to prepare, move and deploy planes from one continent to another.

title: Trump Pays Respects to 2 Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump on Thursday greeted the families of two soldiers killed in Afghanistan a day earlier, the third such visit he has made to Dover Air Force Base in Delaware to honor the dead and comfort their relatives.

title: Day After Debate, Biden and Warren Face Protesters at Events
description: GREENWOOD, S.C.  Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and an immigrants rights activist on Thursday engaged in an unusually extended clash over Obama-era deportation policies.

title: Quotation of the Day: Indictment of Netanyahu Adds to the Political Upheaval in Israel
description: Law enforcement is not a choice. This is not a matter of left or right. This is not a matter of politics.

title: Corrections: Nov. 22, 2019
description: An article on Thursday about a conference for the Arab Council for Regional Integration misidentified a sponsor of the event. It was the Center for Peace Communications, not the Washington Institute for Near East Policy.

title: Face It, Mom and Dad: Im Not Special
description: I come from a polite Midwestern family. We never argue. We acknowledge each others viewpoint and honor each others truth. But to the pantheon of complaints children lodge against their parents (affairs, abandonment, forgotten birthdays), Im adding this: unbridled optimism. My parents believe in the power of positive thinking.

title: Impeachment, Israel, Phoebe Waller-Bridge: Your Friday Briefing
description: Investigators concluded a momentous three-day stretch of public impeachment hearings before the inquiry takes a weeklong break for the U.S. Thanksgiving holiday. There are no hearings scheduled beyond that  as of yet.

title: Whats on TV Friday: Dolly Partons Heartstrings and a New Comedy
description: DOLLY PARTONS HEARTSTRINGS (2019) Stream on Netflix. Songs: theyre just stories put to music, Dolly Parton said in the trailer for Dolly Partons Heartstrings, a scripted anthology series inspired by her music. Parton is an executive producer of the show, which features eight of her songs, including favorites like Jolene, Two Doors Down and If I Had Wings. For each song, an individual narrative is drawn and added to the series, which stars Julianne Hough, Kimberly Williams-Paisley and Ginnifer Goodwin, among others. Much of her music is grounded by an authentic sense of insecurity that shes worked hard to overcome, Lindsay Zoladz wrote of Parton in The New York Times. Shes not a one-dimensional paper Dolly. She has bled.

title: Word + Quiz: beatific
The Jungle Prince of Delhi
description: NEW DELHI  On a spring afternoon in 2016, when I was working in India, I received a telephone message from a recluse who lived in a forest in the middle of Delhi.

title: Feasting With Family
description: The approaching holidays often mean spending more time with family, who come from near and far.  Do you enjoy large family get-togethers or find them overwhelming?

title: With Big Tech in Their Path, Start-Ups Turn to Business Markets
description: When Rajiv Ayyangar and two other Yahoo alumni explored start-up ideas, they experimented with concepts directed at the public, like a personal finance app. But making money from consumers was too daunting, they concluded, partly because of the tight grip that digital giants like Google and Apple had over distribution.

title: The N.B.A., Amid Its Misery, Is Putting on a Show
description: Here is how strange the first month of the N.B.A. season has been: The Portland Trail Blazers, who have done O.K. offensively but poorly on defense, turned to Carmelo Anthony to solve their problems this week. They offered him a starting job right out of the gate, even though he is not known for defensive prowess and hasnt played well in years.

title: Stephen Colbert Takes Issue With Likening Rudy Giuliani to a Hand Grenade
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. If youre interested in hearing from The Times regularly about great TV, sign up for our Watching newsletter and get recommendations straight to your inbox.

title: Victorias Secret, Struggling on Many Fronts, Cancels Annual Fashion Show
description: A colorful spectacle of pop music, skimpy lingerie and some of the worlds most famous supermodels, the Victorias Secret fashion show had long been a ratings powerhouse and a prime-time marketing bonanza.

title: A Lesson Plan for Teaching About the Impeachment Hearings
description: The House of Representatives is investigating whether President Trumps conduct toward Ukraine merits impeachment. Public hearings began last week, and they are being shown live on television. It is only the third time in modern United States history that a public hearing is considering the impeachment of a president.

title: Under U.S. Pressure, South Korea Stays in Intelligence Pact With Japan
description: TOKYO  Under intense pressure from the United States, South Korea reversed itself at the last minute Friday and extended an intelligence-sharing pact with Japan, a sign that the Seoul government wanted to halt fraying relations with the two countries.

title: My Loneliness Keeps Me Going: Fighting for Equality in India
description: RAIPUR, India  It happened one evening as Vidhya Rajput neared her home in the central Indian city of Raipur. A cluster of about two dozen men began screaming slurs at her from the roadside.

title: Does Race Matter? Who Gets to Ask That Question?
description: To the Editor:

title: Weekly Health Quiz: Memory, Canker Sores and Exercise for Mental Health
description: Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: New in Paperback: The War Before the War and Evening in Paradise
description: THE WAR BEFORE THE WAR: Fugitive Slaves and the Struggle for Americas Soul From the Revolution to the Civil War, by Andrew Delbanco. (Penguin, $18.) Delbanco, a professor at Columbia, argues that the persistent legal and moral questions posed by people who fled bondage made the Civil War inevitable. Our reviewer, Sean Wilentz, said this was a valuable book, reflective as well as jarring.

title: The Comfort-Loving Cult of the Lincoln Town Car
description: When not wanting to drive themselves to a given destination, some passengers  be they faithful to Uber or Lyft  feel the need for speed.

title: How Well Do You Read Other People?
description: You walk into a crowded room: Can you tell if the mood is tense or light?

title: Our Best Vegetarian Thanksgiving Recipes
description: For a full-on meat-free Thanksgiving feast or just some dishes to feed a few vegetarians, here are our best vegetarian Thanksgiving recipes for a memorable holiday meal. (Looking for vegan Thanksgiving recipes or gluten-free Thanksgiving recipes? Weve got you covered, too.)

title: Flying Through Fire With a Notepad and a Prayer
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: Colettes Burgundy
description: With her wry sense of humor honed by a coquettish but self-doubting vanity, the French novelist Colette would doubtless have been flattered to see the painstakingly authentic renovation of her childhood home by the Paris decorator Jacques Grange in Saint-Sauveur-en-Puisaye. Born Sidonie-Gabrielle Colette in 1873 in this Burgundian village 115 miles south of Paris, she went on to become a legend of French letters. Colette wrote more than 30 books and was made a member of the Belgian Royal Academy, the prestigious French Acadmie Goncourt and a grand officer of the French Legion of Honor, before becoming the first Frenchwoman ever accorded a state funeral in 1954 (shes buried at Pre Lachaise Cemetery in Paris).

title: Practicing Gratitude, for a Change
description: At Thanksgiving, when the seedling phase of my divorce from the father of my three children was well underway, we agreed it was time for us to start spending holidays apart.

title: Beck Is Captivated by American Myths and a $60 Guitar
description: Im drawn to things that feel like they were made at the wrong time, said the stylistically restless musician Beck, recalling a formative trip to Madrids Prado museum while on tour early in his career. It was his first encounter with Hieronymus Bosch  who painted like a contemporary of Salvador Dal even though he began work on his wild masterpiece The Garden of Earthly Delights way back in 1490. (Ive always intended to try and write an album based on that painting, Beck, 49, said. Im not sure how that would work.)

title: The Zen of Weight Lifting
description: One of my favorite movements at the gym is called a farmers carry. You hold a heavy weight  for me, around 95 pounds  in each hand and attempt to walk with a solid, upright posture for between 30 and 60 seconds.

title: When a College Student Has a Troubled Roommate
description: When college students come home for Thanksgiving, they often bring all sorts of news about the opening months of the school year. Many will have stories to tell about the adjustment to living with roommates. But some may be seeking guidance on living with someone who has significant psychological difficulties.

title: Eric B., Hip-Hop Legend, Avoids Prison in Case Out of the Past
description: Nearly two decades ago, Eric Barrier  facing criminal charges arising from a traffic stop that escalated  hired a lawyer who later went to prison for life.

title: Why Everyone Is Angry at Facebook Over Its Political Ads Policy
description: SAN FRANCISCO  After Google announced restrictions on political advertising this week, campaign strategists in Washington quickly turned their attention to a different company: Facebook.

title: Deepfakes  Believe at Your Own Risk
How Marla Maples Spends Her Sundays
description: Id like to share a little secret with you, said a sympathetic real estate agent, played by Marla Maples, in the 1998 movie Happiness. Divorce was the best thing that ever happened to me.

title: A Racist Books Malign and Lingering Influence
description: One morning in 1972, the French author Jean Raspail was at his home on the Mediterranean coast when he had a vision of a million refugees clamoring to enter Europe.

title: His White House Engulfed, Trump Keeps California in the Cross Hairs
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has never been one to dive into the details of policy, especially now, as an impeachment inquiry threatens to engulf his administration. In recent days, he has allowed his son-in-law to lead a major policy shift in the Middle East and has backed away from a high-profile promise to ban flavored e-cigarettes.

title: New Yorks Best Outdoor Food Fair? We May Have Found It
description: Yailyn Nuez and Christian de Jesus love the Bronx. But one thing is missing, they said: accessibility to different kinds of food.

title: The Parents Passed a Drug Test. Should They Get Their Children Back?
description: PORTSMOUTH, Ohio  Dylan Groves had suffered tremendously long before his tiny body was found in June at the bottom of a 30-foot well, decomposed and wrapped in plastic bags. He had been born a few months earlier with several drugs in his system, and had spent his first days in the care of a foster mother who had cuddled him while he shook and sweated through withdrawal.

title: A One-in-a-Million Voice Arrives at the Met Opera
description: When you hear about the soprano Lise Davidsen, you might find yourself questioning the facts. Could someone who didnt even see an opera until she was in her 20s really be making her Metropolitan Opera debut at 32? Surely she hasnt been singing opera for only a decade?

title: First the Worm Gets in the Bugs Head. Then the Bug Drowns Itself.
description: A few years back, Ryan Herbison, then a graduate student in parasitology at the University of Otago, painstakingly collected about 1,300 earwigs and more than 2,500 sandhoppers from gardens and a beach in New Zealand.

title: Five Places to Visit in Washington, D.C. With a Black Digital Storyteller
description: Lanae Spruce describes herself as a foodie and cultural connoisseur. But in the nations capital, the 31-year-old is better known for digital storytelling and building social media brands. Until September, Ms. Spruce designed and managed the Smithsonian National Museum of African American History and Cultures award-winning social media accounts for more than six years.

title: Restoring Brooklyns Queen of Department Stores
description: For more than a century, Abraham & Straus was the reigning queen of Brooklyn department stores, the centerpiece of a shopping corridor that in its heyday was the boroughs answer to Manhattans Fifth Avenue. Growing to become the fourth largest such store in America, the elegant behemoth was a proud show place  as integral to the boroughs identity as the Brooklyn Dodgers and The Brooklyn Daily Eagle.

title: Chinas Vaping Boom Alarms the Government
description: Models in tight dresses and high heels lounged in a yellow inflatable pool filled with plush toys and vaping equipment. Enthusiastic vapers lined up for free pens and pods, as clouds of mango, mint and rose mingled with the electronic dance music in the air.

title: Imagine Being on Trial. With Exonerating Evidence Trapped on Your Phone.
description: On April 27, a woman in eastern Brooklyn called the police. She told them that just before sunrise, at 5:50 a.m., her ex, John, confronted her on the street with a gun.

title: What Does Oakland Think of Kamala Harris Now?
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  When Senator Kamala Harris announced her presidential campaign on the steps of City Hall here in January, tens of thousands of people showed up, optimistically cheering for a person they believed could be the first woman  the first black woman  in the White House.

title: The Vitality of Six-Man Football
description: McCOOL JUNCTION, Neb.  The town was buzzing.

title: Biking Over the Hudson: Why Its Not Easier
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: Impeachment, Israel, Tesla: Your Friday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Candidates: Pete Buttigieg
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: Via Apple Podcasts | Via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: The Delay Game Was On
description: When Taryn Brown and Nicholas Blatchford first met in 2005, he was giving her a tour of the Bronx high school he was using as a makeshift base for New Heights, a basketball-focused youth development program he had started a few years earlier.

title: After the Protests: How Will Hong Kong Vote?
description: HONG KONG  To reach Mui Wo, a small town on Lantau Island, you take a ferry from central Hong Kong, and after a 30-minute ride arrive at a small square with a car park and bus stops blackened by fumes. But just a minutes walk away is a large, sandy beach overlooked by a tall mountain. As you make your way down the bicycle path, you might have to contend with feral cows and water buffaloes.

title: The Real Cost of Tweeting About My Kids
description: Here is an anecdote I was not allowed to post on Twitter.

title: The Day That Decided the 2020 Election
description: Election Day, 2020. The polls have just closed. All indications point to a resounding verdict. Historians, loath to make narrative sense of an age without waiting for the vapors of passion to pass, agree on one thing.

title: The Double-Barreled Dream World of Trump and His Enablers
description: The Ukraine scandal now unfolding in congressional impeachment hearings has at its core a Shakespearean twist: President Trump, abetted by his paladins of spin, has trapped himself in an alternate universe. To undermine the well-established fact that Russia corrupted the 2016 vote to help him win, Mr. Trump and his allies have tried to build a fiction that pins those crimes on Ukraine.

title: The Racism Right Before Our Eyes
description: Most of our public discourse about racism  when its not about violence or monuments or presidential rhetoric  is about white privilege, implicit bias and structural racism. Instead of specific actors, we tend to focus on forces that dont actually implicate anyone in particular.

title: Will Anyone Buy Elon Musks New Pickup?
description: (Want this by email? Sign up here.)

title: New Zealand Man Convicted of Murder in Grace Millanes Death
description: LONDON  A New Zealand man was found guilty of murder on Friday in the killing of Grace Millane, a British backpacker whose death last year rattled the nation and prompted soul searching in a country where such cases are rare.

title: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood | Anatomy of a Scene
description: The director Marielle Heller narrates a sequence from her film featuring Tom Hanks and Matthew Rhys.

title: Watch Tom Hanks Embody Mister Rogers in A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood
description: In Anatomy of a Scene, we ask directors to reveal the secrets that go into making key scenes in their movies. See new episodes in the series each Friday. You can also watch our collection of more than 150 videos on YouTube and subscribe to our YouTube channel.

title: Hong Kong Court Reinstates Mask Ban Before Citywide Election
description: HONG KONG  A Hong Kong court on Friday temporarily reinstated a ban on wearing face masks that targeted antigovernment protesters, after an earlier ruling found the law unconstitutional in what had been a rare victory for pro-democracy activists.

title: 11,484 Violations: Surprise Inspections Hit N.Y. Construction Sites
description: The million-dollar view of the Manhattan skyline was wasted on Nolan Gutierrez.

title: Manny Jacinto of The Good Place Plummets to Earth
description: Manny Jacinto, a star of the metaphysical sitcom The Good Place, would like to be the kind of actor who does his own stunts. He isnt. After you get hit four or five times, you say, No, O.K., lets get the stunt double, he said.

title: Thousands of Texts at Center of Case Against Woman Charged in Boyfriends Suicide
description: BOSTON  The young woman stood almost frozen, her hands clasped in front of her, as the prosecutor read from her texts to her college boyfriend.

title: The Lefts Identity Problem
description: This article is part of David Leonhardts newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it each weekday.

title: The Week in Tech: A.I.s Threat to White-Collar Jobs
description: Each week, we review the weeks news, offering analysis about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: N.F.L. Week 12 Predictions: Our Picks Against the Spread
description: The Patriots are trying to improve to 10-1 with the Cowboys in their way; the Seahawks are seeking an important road win at Philadelphia; and the Falcons  yes, the Falcons  are trying to stay red hot. These games make for solid appetizers, but the real meal will take place near San Francisco, where Aaron Rodgers and the Packers will try their best to find room to pass against the dominant pass rush and secondary of the 49ers.

title: A Beresford Duplex for Broadway Royalty
description: The former home of the Broadway veterans Phyllis Newman and Adolph Green, where they dazzled a long list of showbiz friends, is on the market.

title: A Theatrical Duplex at the Beresford Is Listed for $24 Million
description: A duplex at the landmark Beresford tower on the Upper West Side that served as both home and creative space for the Broadway veterans Phyllis Newman and Adolph Green is coming to market for the first time in more than half a century.

title: Building a Better Bonfire in Berkeley
description: Good morning.

title: Trump Attacks Impeachment Inquiry and Accuses a Witness of Lying
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump unleashed a series of falsehoods on Friday in an effort to invalidate the impeachment inquiry and counter sworn testimony from officials in his own administration, after a week of damaging public hearings.

title: Israelis Call Netanyahu Indictment an Earthquake, but Agree on Little Else
description: LOD, Israel  Watching Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu attack the prosecutors who had just indicted him, watching him beg for compassion for his familys suffering through years of corruption investigations, Tzion Hagag said he began to question whether the rule of law was really all that worth preserving if it could be so unfair to such a great man.

title: Afghan Vote Crawls Toward Crisis, With No Results After 2 Months
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Nearly two months after Afghans braved hundreds of Taliban attacks to cast ballots in a vote for president, the results have been repeatedly delayed, and protests have blocked election officials from auditing and recounting problematic votes in several provinces.

title: The Family Meal: Tips for Staying Sane and Sated
description: Holiday time is stressful for a variety of reasons, particularly when it comes to eating. Worries about overeating, family conflicts and dinner guests with special dietary needs are enough to make you want to cancel the holiday meal altogether!

title: Will Instagram Ever Free the Nipple?
description: Photographers have learned to be inventive in evading Instagrams ban on female nipples. Theyve used paint, glitter, hair and flower petals to obscure them. Theyve covered them up with leaves, cornstarch, a spatula, handbags, shot glasses, strands of bubble gum, and sand.

title: Shes the Queen of Tap. Is Her Moment Now?
description: Like Beyonc or Prince, the tap dancer Dormeshia is singular enough to need no surname. In her field, she is unsurpassed in all-roundedness. Other tap dancers make artistic compromises. They sacrifice elegance for complexity, or sound for visual beauty, or the reverse. Not Dormeshia. In her dancing, nothing is missing. Music and motion are a unified impulse, a perfect whole, and every time she improvises, the history of tap meets its cutting edge.

title: The Pop Musical: Go Big (and Loud) or Go Home
description: Sometimes, I crave a musical where grandiosity is unencumbered by logic and good taste. I dont need a book that makes sense when I can feast on eye-popping visuals backed by an eardrum-busting sound system. Its O.K. for the brain to take a rest while the senses work overtime. Broadway knew that once, or at least Florenz Ziegfeld did.

title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
description: No matter how much free time you have this weekend, we have TV recommendations for you. Come back every week for new suggestions on what to watch.

title: Viking Treasure Could Have Made Them a Fortune. Instead, They Stole It.
description: LONDON  More than 1,000 years ago, a Viking hoard of gold jewelry, coins and silver bars was buried for safekeeping.

title: Leftovers Never Tasted This Good
description: Good morning. Youll be making pie dough this weekend. (Right?) Youll be buying wine for the feast. (Or farming out that job to siblings?) Youll be standing in the dining room and staring at the table and wondering how many people really can fit around it before you have to bust out the plywood and sawhorses, the extra-long runner, the chairs from upstairs. (Or is that just me?) Anyway, youre looking at two days of lists, check marks and lots of Thanksgiving self-instruction this weekend, and a lot of physical work on top of that if youve got a yard and its filled with leaves.

title: Protesters Confront Warren and Biden at Campaign Events
description: In Georgia, Senator Elizabeth Warren was interrupted by protests because of her plan to cut charter school funding. And in South Carolina, immigrants rights activists clashed with former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. over Obama-era deportation policies.

title: Trump Says Hes Standing With Xi (and With Hong Kongs Protesters)
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump refused to commit Friday to signing legislation overwhelmingly passed by Congress to support pro-democracy activists in Hong Kong, saying that he supported the protesters but that President Xi Jinping of China was a friend of mine.

title: Barr Says Epsteins Suicide Resulted From Perfect Storm of Screw-Ups
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General William P. Barr said in an interview published on Friday that the death of Jeffrey Epstein, the financier accused of sex trafficking, in a secure federal prison resulted from a perfect storm of screw-ups, rather than any nefarious act.

title: France Vowed to Return Looted Treasures. But Few Are Heading Back.
description: A year ago this week, in a pioneering announcement, President Emmanuel Macron of France said that his country would give back 26 looted treasures to the African state of Benin. It was a bold statement by the leader of a former colonial power. He also took delivery of an independent report he had commissioned, which sent shock waves through museums around the world.

title: Why Fox News Slimed a Purple Heart Recipient
description: This article has been updated to reflect additional information about the author.

title: The 10 Best Books of 2019
description: In the first chapter of this assured debut novel, two young girls vanish, sending shock waves through a town perched on the edge of the remote, brooding Kamchatka Peninsula. What follows is a novel of overlapping short stories about the various women who have been affected by their disappearance. Each richly textured tale pushes the narrative forward another month and exposes the ways in which the women of Kamchatka have been shattered  personally, culturally and emotionally  by the crime.

title: What Is Netanyahus Game Plan?
description: TEL AVIV  Israelis who enjoy political drama just had a great week. Israelis who care about the future of their country, not so much.

title: To Help Holiday Crowds, New York to Close Streets Near Rockefeller Center
description: Countless visitors make the pilgrimage to Fifth Avenue in Manhattan during the holidays to bask in the glow of the towering Christmas tree at Rockefeller Center, gawk at glittering window displays, and take selfies with sidewalk Santas.

title: Your Thanksgiving May Be Classic, but Your Leftovers Dont Have to Be
description: My dad always said that the best part of the Thanksgiving turkey was nibbling the crisp, fatty bits of skin that fell off his knife as he carved. The turkey sandwiches the next day were the second best part.

title: Dogs Cant Help Falling in Love
description: TEMPE, Ariz.  Xephos is not the author of Dog Is Love: Why and How Your Dog Loves You, one of the latest books to plumb the nature of dogs, but she helped inspire it. And as I scratched behind her ears, it was easy to see why.

title: Stuck in Arctic Ice, Dodging Polar Bears. All for Science.
description: Despite difficult ice conditions and curious polar bears, a German research icebreaker with 100 scientists and crew members is comfortably adrift in the frozen Central Arctic, two months into a yearlong expedition to study the regions changing climate.

title: Jake Burton Carpenter, Who Ushered in Snowboarding as a Sport, Dies at 65
description: Jake Burton Carpenter, whose once-modest plan to make 50 snowboards a day turned into something far bigger  a global business that helped drive snowboarding into a popular Olympic sport  died on Wednesday in a hospital in Burlington, Vt. He was 65.

title: Review: At the Philharmonic, a Much-Needed Dose of Joy
description: While the New York Philharmonics music director, Jaap van Zweden, has been away over the past month, the orchestra has engaged in a form of speed dating with different conductors who have shown just how malleable this ensembles sound can be.

title: Charlotte Bront and Ruth Bader Ginsburg, Before the World Knew Them
description: Glynnis Fawkess graphic biography of Charlotte Bront opens with the 20-year-old aspiring writer receiving a letter from the poet Robert Southey. He warns her, Literature cannot be the business of a womans life. Find yourself a husband, he says; write poems on the side if you must. But creative aspirations? Forget about it.

title: Squatters Were In and Out of Abandoned House Where 3 Died in Fire
description: For years, residents in Queens had been concerned about an abandoned house in their neighborhood, telling officials the property was unsafe and had become a home for squatters.

title: Can South America Produce a Superclub?
description: Get Rory Smiths weekly newsletter on world soccer in your inbox every Friday. Its free! Sign up here at nytimes.com/rory.

title: Eight Audiobook Classics Written, and Narrated, by Women
description: Some audiobooks you listen to when you dont have time to sit down and read the physical book. And others you listen to even if youve read their corresponding hardcovers again and again, the voices revivifying timeworn texts.

title: Pakistan Blames India for Its Air Pollution. Its Citizens Disagree.
description: A new front in the decades-long rivalry between India and Pakistan has emerged: which country is more responsible for the choking air pollution that straddles their shared, hostile border.

title: The Impeachment Inquiry Goes Public
description: The past two weeks of public impeachment testimony before the House Intelligence Committee produced indelible scenes of drama and confrontation. The photographs here are images that will fill American textbooks for generations, whatever the outcome of the proceedings. Unseen but vividly present was the most important character of all, the 45th president of the United States, Donald J. Trump, only the fourth president to face possible impeachment.

title: Larry David: Imagining What Keeps Trump Up at Night
description: July 2019. The White House  3 a.m. Donald Trump tosses and turns.

title: U.K. Takes Back Children From Former ISIS Territory
description: LONDON  Several unaccompanied children have been repatriated from former Islamic State territory in Syria to Britain, as European nations grapple with questions about what to do with the potential return of citizens who joined the terrorist group.

title: The Modern Life of Origami, an Art as Old as Paper
description: I would say the biggest rule is no cutting, said Wendy Zeichner, the president and chief executive of OrigamiUSA. Its one piece of paper and no glue.

title: The Martians Are Coming!
The Playlist: Paul McCartneys Upbeat Outtakes and 9 More New Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos. Just want the music? Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes). Like what you hear? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.

title: No Longer Forgotten: Ohio Students Have Headstone Made for Black Settlers
description: On a barren patch of grass in a cemetery in North Olmsted, Ohio, a group of students this week commemorated two black families believed to be buried in unmarked plots there.

title: Kids Have Questions. These Picture Books Have Answers.
description: WHAT COLOR IS NIGHT?

title: The No-Turkey Zone
description: Hi and welcome to Five Weeknight Dishes. I realize that you may need either potato recipes (make this one!) or pie recipes (so many options here). But I believe that what we really need are ideas for all the other meals next week, dishes that have nothing to do with turkey or, even better, taste nothing like Thanksgiving whatsoever.

title: Dissecting the 2020 Grammy Nominations
description: With each years Grammy nominations comes the griping: the Grammys are too old, the Grammys are too male, the Grammys are too white. But the nominations for the 62nd Grammy Awards, which will take place on Jan. 26, were a surprise. The most-nominated artists are young and forward-looking. The enthusiastically upbeat singer-rapper Lizzo received eight nominations. Billie Eilish, the years most vivid young breakthrough, received six, as did Lil Nas X, who at this time last year was still a social-media gadfly looking for a meme-assisted breakthrough into the music world.

title: Review: A Must-Hear Maestro Leads Requiem at the Shed
description: In the early days of MusicAeterna, the orchestra and chorus he founded 15 years ago in Siberia, the conductor Teodor Currentzis worked in relative obscurity.

title: Its Enrollment Time for Obamacare
description: Shop, compare  and beware, when shopping for health insurance outside official government marketplaces.

title: What Josephine Baker and a Maharajah Teach Us About Design
description: In Paris, the deep design shift that occurred during the interwar years when Modernism superseded Art Deco has long kept architecture historians scribbling. But two events in Paris  a recent week of performances in Le Corbusiers famous Villa Savoye and Moderne Maharajah, a show at the Museum of Decorative Arts through January  open up our understanding of a period we thought we knew cold. Each of the two events sees design through a polarizing cultural lens.

title: Famous Voices Take Center Stage at Italys Dubbing Oscars
description: ROME  Just like the Oscars, the gala held Thursday night at Romes music auditorium included a red carpet complete with a noisy cluster of paparazzi snapping pouting actors. Most people, however, would have struggled to put a name to the faces.

title: Moderate Voters Could Decide the Democratic Nominee. What Do They Want?
description: Welcome to Poll Watch, our weekly look at polling data and survey research on the candidates, voters and issues that will shape the 2020 election.

title: Charges of Ukrainian Meddling? A Russian Operation, U.S. Intelligence Says
description: WASHINGTON  Republicans have sought for weeks amid the impeachment inquiry to shift attention to President Trumps demands that Ukraine investigate any 2016 election meddling, defending it as a legitimate concern while Democrats accuse Mr. Trump of pursuing fringe theories for his benefit.

title: Debating U.S. Policy on the West Bank Settlements
description: To the Editor:

title: Michael J. Pollard, Character Actor in Bonnie and Clyde, Dies at 80
description: Michael J. Pollard, who rose to fame in the 1967 hit film Bonnie and Clyde as C.W. Moss, the dimwitted gas station attendant who became a criminal accomplice, and went on to a long career as a Hollywood character actor, died on Wednesday at a hospital in Los Angeles. He was 80.

title: Ex-Fox News Hosts Business Partner Charged in Real Estate Scheme
description: The former business partner of Clayton Morris, the Fox News host turned financial guru, was indicted by a federal grand jury and arrested at his home in Indianapolis on Thursday on charges that he defrauded real estate investors recruited by Mr. Morris.

title: Huawei Funds Are Cut Off by F.C.C. Over Security Threats
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Communications Commission voted on Friday to bar cellular carriers from using federal subsidies to buy equipment from Huawei and ZTE, two Chinese companies, saying the companies endangered national security.

title: Love Letter: Lets Eat Together!
description: [Sign up here to receive Love Letter, a weekly newsletter about relationship highs, lows and woes, in your inbox every Friday.]

title: New Rating System for Charities Aims to Measure Impact of Gifts
description: It has become the holy grail of philanthropy: measuring the impact of a charitable contribution. Donors dont want their money misused or used less effectively than it could be, but how can impact be measured?

title: The Likability Trap Is Still a Thing
description: Senator Amy Klobuchar, Democratic presidential candidate

title: White Alabama Officer Guilty of Manslaughter for Killing Black Man
description: An Alabama jury found a white police officer guilty of manslaughter on Friday in the fatal shooting of an unarmed black man in Montgomery in 2016, the latest case in which an officer has been held to account for using lethal force.

title: Guido Badano, Officer in the Andrea Doria Crash, Dies at 92
description: Guido Badano, a 29-year-old officer aboard the glamorous Italian ocean liner Andrea Doria, was asleep in his bunk, relieved of his duties for a while, when two short blasts from the ships whistle, signaling an impending turn to the left, jolted him awake. It was shortly after 11 oclock on the night of July 25, 1956.

title: Takeaways From the Impeachment Hearings
description: To the Editor:

title: The Life and Death of the Local Hardware Store
description: On Ninth Avenue in Manhattan, not far from where I live, theres a small neighborhood hardware store called Chelsea Convenience Hardware, which is distinguished by its unlikely display of dozens of Russian nesting dolls in the storefront window. Inside, tools and supplies are piled to the ceiling, and when you enter, the owner, Naum Feygin, an immigrant from Boris Yeltsins Russia, looks up to ask you what you need.

title: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads
description: Welcome to the weekend. It might be the one to clean out your fridge ahead of Thanksgiving. After the avalanche of news this week, perhaps youre looking for a bit of cleaning zen. Or maybe its time to make some mulled cider or mulled wine and catch up with friends. Whatever youre doing, make time for some great journalism.

title: The Artist Couple Making Ceramics on a 19th-Century Farm in Paris
description: The branches of the quince tree hanging over the front gate of the Parisian home of the ceramic artists Michel and Andre Hirlet heave with knobbly yellow fruit, adding color to an otherwise gray streetscape. There were more a few days ago, but we put a note on the gate saying that we are giving out quinces, and now we have the jam the neighbors have made, Andre reports, gesturing through the open kitchen door to the glass pots resting on a bench.

title: Canadian Official Calls for Removal of Key Software From 737 Max
description: A manager at Canadas aviation regulator believes that Boeing should remove software that played a role in two deadly crashes of its 737 Max before the plane is cleared to fly again, according to emails between global aviation regulators this week that were reviewed by The New York Times.

title: Our National Parks Are in Trouble
description: CARBONDALE, Colo.   Deep inside Alaskas six-million-acre Denali National Park and Preserve, I could see miles of space beneath my feet as I stood on the summit of the tallest mountain in North America. The startling view from the 20,310-foot Denali of rugged wilderness spreading out in all directions, plus the challenge of climbing it, were just two of the many wonders and adventures that Ive experienced in Americas national parks.

title: Mark Cuban Buys Democracy.com
description: Well, you had your chance.

title: Wait  Are You Thankful?
description: Some tragedies, or some reasons to be grateful.

title: Russia Inquiry Review Is Said to Criticize F.B.I. but Rebuff Claims of Biased Acts
description: WASHINGTON  A highly anticipated report by the Justice Departments inspector general is expected to sharply criticize lower-level F.B.I. officials as well as bureau leaders involved in the early stages of the Trump-Russia investigation, but to absolve the top ranks of abusing their powers out of bias against President Trump, according to people briefed on a draft.

title: An Outtake From The Daily
description: Astead Herndon sings.

title: For Those Whove Seen Parasite and Want More
description: Parasite has burrowed in deep. The South Korean class satire, directed by Bong Joon Ho, is poised to be this years highest-grossing subtitled release in the United States. In May, when it became the first Korean-language movie to win the top prize at Cannes, the director noted that the festival had chosen to honor the film in the centennial year of Korean cinema, and called the award a very great gift.

title: Latest in the N.B.A. Injury Crisis: Kemba Walker on a Stretcher
description: Injuries happen in all professional sports. Players get hurt, even when they are in top physical shape.

title: The Moral Injury of Pardoning War Crimes
description: Post-traumatic stress  the nightmares, flashbacks and anxiety set off by terrifying events  is a defining injury of the global war on terrorism. But in the past few decades, the mental health community and the military have come to understand that there is a related, intensifying phenomenon called moral injury.

title: Bloomberg Prepares Huge TV Blitz, Reserving $30 Million in Ads
description: Michael R. Bloomberg, the billionaire former mayor of New York City, spent at least $30 million on Friday for a single week of television ads, a show of financial force that signals his willingness to use his vast personal fortune to reshape the Democratic presidential race.

title: The Four Lessons of Impeachment
description: After two weeks of compelling testimony in the House impeachment inquiry, its worth weighing what has emerged. Four conclusions stand out.

title: She Texted About Dinner While Driving. Then a Pedestrian Was Dead.
description: FREEHOLD, N.J.  One woman was out for a walk and a taste of fresh air during a break from her job as a scientist at a New Jersey fragrance manufacturer. She and her husband had been trying to get pregnant, and brief bouts of exercise, away from the laboratorys smells and fumes, were part of that plan.

title: How We Chose a Moment for Pete Buttigieg
description: Todays episode kicks off The Candidates, a new series from The Daily that profiles the four top-polling Democratic presidential contenders: Pete Buttigieg, Bernie Sanders, Elizabeth Warren and Joe Biden. Producers Clare Toeniskoetter and Luke Vander Ploeg told us about how they approached the first episode:

title: How the Book Review Makes Its 10 Best List
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: Latest Turn in Case of Missing Woman: Ex-Boyfriend Dies in Suicide
description: John Ozbilgen was familiar to the authorities. He had been arrested twice for domestic violence since June. When the police came to his New Jersey home this month, it was to search his phone for possible clues about where his former girlfriend, who had vanished two days earlier, might be.

title: Jeff Bezos, Anna Wintour and Lin-Manuel Miranda Unveil Their Portraits
description: Also, Guggenheim and the Dia Art Foundation held benefits.

title: American Portraits
description: The National Portrait Gallery in Washington unveiled six portraits at its gala on Nov. 17. The Guggenheim International Gala honored Frank Gehry and others on Nov. 14. And the Dia Art Foundation honored Sam Gilliam at its benefit on Nov. 17 in Chelsea.

title: The Mandalorian Director: Baby Yoda Steals the Show
description: [This article contains spoilers for the Disney Plus series The Mandalorian.]

title: A Sampling of Gahan Wilsons New Yorker cartoons
description: His work  seen in National Lampoon, Playboy, The New Yorker and other magazines  was full of visual surprises and black humor.

title: Barrs Legal Views Come Under Fire From Conservative-Leaning Lawyers
description: WASHINGTON  A group of conservative-leaning lawyers criticized Attorney General William P. Barr for the expansive view of presidential power he espoused in a recent speech and for his conclusion this spring that President Trump had not obstructed justice in the Russia investigation.

title: Gahan Wilson, Vividly Macabre Cartoonist, Dies at 89
description: Gahan Wilson, whose outlandish, often ghoulish cartoons added a bizarrely humorous touch to Playboy, The New Yorker, National Lampoon and other publications in the era when magazines propelled the cultural conversation, died on Thursday in Scottsdale, Ariz. He was 89.

title: Google Changed Its Political Ad Policy. Will Facebook Be Next?
