description: This was a bad week for the head of the Trump campaign, Brad Parscale, but not because of the blockbuster testimony of Americas ambassador to the European Union, Gordon Sondland, in the impeachment hearings linking his boss to the pay-for-play scheme in Ukraine.

title: Trump Warns a Flavor Ban Would Spawn Counterfeit Vaping Products
description: WASHINGTON  Two months after announcing that he planned to ban the sale of most flavored e-cigarettes, President Trump on Friday once again raised concerns about such restrictions during a lively, televised White House meeting that brought together top executives from the health community and the tobacco and vaping industries.

title: Review: At the Bolshoi, Giselle Is Rethought, Refreshed, Revivified
description: MOSCOW  The Bolshoi Ballet is not short of Giselle productions. Until very recently the company performed two, one by Yuri Grigorovich (1986) and one by Vladimir Vasiliev (1997). Do they need a new one? If its Alexei Ratmanskys exquisitely faceted re-creation, which had its premiere here on Thursday, the answer is: absolutely.

title: The Authorized Life of the Iron Lady
description: Subscribe: iTunes | Google Play Music | How to Listen

title: Keep Pets From Destroying Your Stuff
description: This is why we cant have nice things.

title: Four Years After Sunny Ways, a Muted Restart for Justin Trudeau
description: Because its 2019, the swearing in of Prime Minister Justin Trudeaus new cabinet this week was a dramatically different affair than his first such ceremony four years ago.

title: BTS, the K-Pop Superstars, Must Serve in South Koreas Military
description: The seven members of the K-pop group BTS, the first South Korean musicians to top the Billboard charts, must fulfill their mandatory military service, the countrys defense ministry confirmed this week.

title: Russia, the Arctic, Books of the Year: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Ex-C.I.A. Officer Sentenced to 19 Years in Chinese Espionage Conspiracy
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va.  A former C.I.A. officer was sentenced to 19 years in prison on Friday for conspiring to deliver classified information to China in a case that touched on the mysterious unraveling of the agencys informant network in China but did little to solve it.

title: C.D.C. Issues E. Coli Warning on Romaine Lettuce Ahead of Thanksgiving
description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention warned consumers on Friday not to eat any romaine lettuce from Salinas, Calif., after at least 40 cases of E. coli infection nationwide were linked to contaminated products from that region.

title: Tuesday Afternoon Impeachment Is as Big as Monday Night Football
description: On the third day that impeachment hearings blanketed American televisions, from morning talk shows to late-night monologues, Representative Devin Nunes came out with a public service announcement.

title: Our Professors Views Are Vile, University Says. But We Cant Fire Him.
description: The provost did not mince her words about the opinions of a professor on her campus. His views were racist, sexist and homophobic, she wrote in a statement this week. They were vile and stupid, she said, and more consistent with someone who lived in the 18th century than the 21st.

title: Black Leader in South Bend Endorses Joe Biden Over Pete Buttigieg
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind.  An African-American official of South Bend, Ind., endorsed Joseph R. Biden Jr. for president on Friday, snubbing the citys mayor, Pete Buttigieg, in a close-to-home example of Mr. Buttigiegs struggle to attract black support.

title: Davis Cup Sees Its Old Soul in the Tears of a Vanquished Serbian Team
description: MADRID  The old Davis Cup made Viktor Troicki the man of the moment in Serbia: feted in Belgrade and beyond after winning the decisive match of the 2010 final.

title: A Call to Fox & Friends
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: Via Apple Podcasts | Via Spotify | Via Stitcher

title: Fred Cox, Vikings Kicker and an Inventor of Nerf Football, Dies at 80
description: Fred Cox, a place-kicker for the Minnesota Vikings who scored the most points in the teams history and, while still playing, helped conceive the Nerf Football, a squishy faux pigskin that sold in the millions, died on Wednesday at his home in Monticello, Minn. He was 80.

title: Navy SEALs Case Reveals Broad Scope of a Presidents Military Powers
description: In an October White House photo, President Trump presented the militarys ultimate symbol of heroism, the Medal of Honor, to a dog. It was a joke, a doctored photo reposted on the presidents Twitter account. But even though the president didnt actually award the Medal of Honor to a dog, legal scholars agree that as commander in chief of the military, he could have.

title: Would-Be Chinese Defector Details Covert Campaigns in Hong Kong and Taiwan
description: BEIJING  A man claiming to be a disillusioned Chinese intelligence operative has told the Australian authorities that Chinas military intelligence agencies were directly intervening in politics in Hong Kong and Taiwan, buying media coverage, infiltrating universities, funneling donations to favored candidates and creating thousands of social media accounts to attack Taiwans governing party.

title: Bolton Teases a City Eager to Hear His Story
description: WASHINGTON  For weeks, Washington has waited to hear what he had to say. So when John R. Bolton, the presidents former national security adviser, popped back up on Twitter on Friday morning with a teasing message, it sent the town, well, all atwitter.

title: U.S. Judge Orders Iran to Pay $180 Million to Washington Post Reporter and Family
description: A federal judge on Friday ordered Iran to pay a Washington Post reporter and his family nearly $180 million in damages after the reporter was imprisoned for almost 18 months during which he was psychologically tortured and physically abused.

title: 100 Protest Leaders Arrested, Iran Says, as U.S. Penalizes a Top Official
description: Irans judiciary said Friday that about 100 people accused of having led violent antigovernment protests over fuel price increases had been arrested nationwide, and a top cleric said they deserved the maximum penalty.

title: Impeachment Briefing: How Republicans Are Using Hearings
description: What happened in this weeks impeachment hearings? Your answer might depend on which lawmakers you were watching.

title: Trumps Long List of Inaccurate Statements on Fox & Friends
description: In a freewheeling 53-minute interview on Friday morning on Fox News, President Trump rattled off exaggerations, falsehoods and debunked conspiracy theories, often related to the impeachment inquiry. Many of them have previously been fact-checked by The New York Times and found false, including his claim that Ukraine, rather than Russia, was behind the hacking of the Democratic National Committee in 2016; his accusation that the Obama administration wiretapped him; and his characterization of the whistle-blowers report as baseless. Heres a check of some of his newer assertions.

title: The Yankees Hired a Hitting Coach. Her Name Is Rachel.
description: As she took a morning stroll on the beach in Ft. Lauderdale, Fla., this week while attending Slugfest, a three-day conference featuring top Major League Baseball hitting coaches, Rachel Balkovec paused to greet a fellow early riser.

title: Wilder and Ortiz Meet Again at a Key Time for Heavyweights
description: Boxings heavyweight division is shedding the old sports clich of taking it one game at a time.

title: Netanyahus Cry of Attempted Coup Sounds Familiar
description: When the Israeli attorney general filed corruption charges against Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday, his political rivals were quick to dredge up a statement he made 11 years ago, when his predecessor as prime minister fell afoul of the law.

title: The United States Is Starting to Look Like Ukraine
description: Donald Trump ought to be impeached and removed from office. This isnt what I thought two months ago, when the impeachment inquiry began. I argued that the evidence fell short of the standards of a prosecutable criminal act. I also feared impeachment might ultimately help Trump politically, as it had helped Bill Clinton in 1998. That second worry might still prove true.

title: Ta-Nehisi Coates: The Cancellation of Colin Kaepernick
description: We are being told of the evils of cancel culture, a new scourge that enforces purity, banishes dissent and squelches sober and reasoned debate. But cancel culture is not new. A brief accounting of the illustrious and venerable ranks of blocked and dragged Americans encompasses Sarah Good, Elijah Lovejoy, Ida B. Wells, Dalton Trumbo, Paul Robeson and the Dixie Chicks. What was the Compromise of 1877, which ended Reconstruction, but the cancellation of the black South? What were the detention camps during World War II but the racist muting of Japanese-Americans and their basic rights?

title: Fiona Hill and the American Idea
description: For a naturalized American, raised in Britain, I found Fiona Hills testimony at impeachment hearings this week to be a powerful reminder of what makes America great and of how President Trump has taken a sledgehammer to its role as a beacon of hope in the world.

title: Justice Dept. Urges Supreme Court to Back Trump in Tax Records Case
description: The Justice Department filed a friend-of-the-court brief on Friday urging the Supreme Court to hear President Trumps appeal seeking to keep his financial records private. Mr. Trump is trying to block a subpoena from Manhattan prosecutors that would require his accounting firm to turn over eight years of his personal and corporate tax returns.

title: A Senate Trial Could Put Trumps Use of Aggressive Defense Tactics to Their Biggest Test
description: WASHINGTON  Over four decades in public life, President Trump has sought to bend business, real-estate and political rivals to his will. Facts that cut against his position have been declared false. Witnesses who have questioned his motives have been declared dishonest. Critics of his behavior are part of a corrupt, shadowy effort aiming to damage him.

title: Term(s) of Endearment
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Tough cluing today, as well as a formidable layout, made this grid intimidating to get started on. The pinwheel formation makes four quadrants that dont help each other at all; also, there are only 62 entries (an average Saturday is 69), which means fewer black boxes and longer (and usually harder) entries, as a whole. Sometimes the constraints of a grid like this can make for some blooper entries, but anything boring in the grid today was brought to life by a sparkling clue.

title: Quotation of the Day: Malign Accusers and Attack Facts
description: He once told me that if you stay with a position long enough, theres a very good chance it would become correct.

title: Each Put Pen to Paper, and Their Story Began
description: Robert Evan Bank and Alan Lawrence Cohen are to be married Nov. 24 at Bnai Jeshurun in New York. Rabbi Shuli Passow is to officiate.

title: Corrections: Nov. 23, 2019
description: An article on Friday about a family in India who masqueraded for decades as Oudh royalty misstated the dollar value of 10,000 rupees in 1975. It was about $1,200, not $90,000.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Will Ferrell on S.N.L. and The Feed
description: SATURDAY NIGHT LIVE 11:29 p.m. on NBC. Its hard to believe that Will Ferrell, who was an S.N.L. cast member for seven years and is credited with some of the shows most memorable characters, will just now be hosting the show for a fifth time. On Saturday, Ferrell will be inaugurated into the so-called Five-Timers Club, joining a group of stars that includes Bill Murray, Justin Timberlake and Tina Fey. Before becoming a major movie star, Ferrell got big laughs as the cowbell-happy member of the Blue yster Cult and as Craig, the pep rally-ready Spartan cheerleader, as well as for his spot-on impressions of George W. Bush, Robert Goulet and Alex Trebek. The musical guest will be the 20-year-old songwriter King Princess, making her S.N.L. debut.

title: The Phoenix Suns Hot Start Has Cooled, but Theyre O.K. With That
description: PHOENIX  The Suns are familiar with adversity. Long considered one of the leagues more dysfunctional franchises this side of Madison Square Garden, Phoenix has not tasted the postseason since 2010, back when many of the players on the current roster were in high school.

title: No Zion, RJ or Cam Means More Balance for Duke
description: Standing in a corner of the victorious locker room at Madison Square Garden late Thursday night, RJ Barrett laughed and talked to Tre Jones and Joey Baker, two former Duke teammates.

title: The Broken Promise of a Panda: How Pragues Relations With Beijing Soured
description: PRAGUE  On the top floor of an opulent Art Deco building in the heart of old Prague, the new lord mayor was standing with a glass of sparkling wine in hand, greeting diplomats as they made their way into his official residence for a New Years gathering.

title: Merkel and Macron Publicly Clash Over NATO
description: BRUSSELS  Angela Merkel, the German chancellor, was uncharacteristically furious. At a dinner to celebrate the 30th anniversary of the fall of the Berlin Wall, she huddled with President Emmanuel Macron of France, who had just given an interview in which he cited the brain death of NATO and wondered whether its commitment to collective defense still held.

title: What Is Intermittent Fasting and Does It Really Work?
description: Generally, intermittent fasting is a diet strategy that involves alternating periods of eating and extended fasting (meaning no food at all or very low calorie consumption). Theres quite a bit of debate in our research community: How much of the benefits of intermittent fasting are just due to the fact that it helps people eat less? Could you get the same benefits by just cutting your calories by the same amount? said Courtney M. Peterson, Ph.D., an assistant professor in the Department of Nutrition Sciences at the University of Alabama at Birmingham who studies time-restricted feeding, a form of intermittent fasting.

title: Inside the War for Californias Cannabis Churches
description: LOS ANGELES  Every Sunday, about two dozen people gather at a green cabin along the main drag of Big Bear, Calif., a small mountain town known for its namesake lake. They go there for Jah Healing Church services, where joints are passed around.

title: Can Fan Fiction Bridge the Partisan Divide?
description: Last Friday, when Marie Yovanovitch, the former United States ambassador to Ukraine, appeared before the House Intelligence Committee, millions of people were watching. Perhaps you were one of them; the public hearings, after all, are the reality show everyone seems to be talking about these days.

title: 5 Gift Ideas for Travelers
description: People who are constantly on the road  whether for work or for fun  likely have most of the essentials that travelers need, which means that a truly thoughtful gift for them has to go beyond the basics or be something they wouldnt splurge on for themselves. Here, a range of experts, including Wirecutter staffers and Sebastian Modak, this years 52 Places Traveler, share their picks for the most compelling gifts for your favorite frequent flier.

title: The Mens Cardigan Makes a Comeback
description: Paternal. Sexless. Infinitely square. The cardigan sweater is generally considered the Mister Rogers of mens wear, and for good reason: Fred Rogers made sure of it.

title: Fitting in Family Fitness at the Holidays
description: Milk-gallon dead lifts, shared inchworms, synchronized walking and a little misdirection could be the keys to staying in shape and in harmony with loved ones during the holiday weeks ahead, experts say.

title: When U.S.C. Plays U.C.L.A., They Play Too
description: You know that classic high school movie scene in which the cafeteria is broken down into cliques? The jocks, the nerds, the goths, the band geeks?

title: Our Best Thanksgiving Recipes: Turkey, Mashed Potatoes, Pumpkin Pie and More
description: Whether youre serving a full table or just a few, you will find all the recipes and how-to guides you need on NYT Cooking to host a memorable Thanksgiving dinner. Well help you with planning (building a menu, accommodating special diets) with our guide on how to cook and plan Thanksgiving. When youre ready to choose your dishes, check out our interactive Thanksgiving menu planner. If you just want to browse, here are hundreds of our best Thanksgiving recipes. (For those with special diets, weve compiled our best vegan Thanksgiving recipes, vegetarian Thanksgiving recipes and gluten-free Thanksgiving recipes.)

title: Juggling Her Brothers Needs and Her Own
description: Destinee Gonzalez Gil was nervous when she sat for the SAT exam last year.

title: Roger Federer, Sneakerhead?
description: If you run into Roger Federer on your way to board a plane, do not be surprised if he looks you up and down, or mostly down. Thats because Mr. Federer has something of a sneaker fixation.

title: Debate 5, and a Push for Black Voters: This Week in the 2020 Race
description: It was a busy week in the Democratic presidential campaign, with a flood of new policies and, of course, another debate.

title: Nazi Symbols and Racist Memes: Combating School Intolerance
description: BEAVERTON, Ore.  An 18-year-old senior at Battle Ground High School in Washington State was immersed in a fighting video game with a couple of online friends in March when news broke about a violent shooter targeting New Zealand mosques.

title: A Do-Anywhere Full-Body Workout
description: How can anybody fit in a simple, quick, full-body workout, anywhere?

title: Celebrating the Modern Ballroom Scene
description: PHILADELPHIA  Tonight you are in a blended world, said M.C. Jack Mizrahi, a ballroom veteran and historian, at the Champion Art Ball. Were going to take art, were going to take vogue, were going to take ballroom, and were going to give you a tableau vivant right in front of your face. This is a safe space for everybody, we can learn from each other.

title: Four Problems With 2016 Trump Polling That Could Play Out Again in 2020
description: Meetings of the American Association of Public Opinion Research tend to be pretty staid affairs. But when members of the group gathered for a conference call at this time in 2016, the polling industry was experiencing a crisis of confidence.

title: In the Jersey Suburbs, a Bookstore Whose Vibe Is Pure Narnia
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  Montclair Book Center is 35 years old, going on eternity.

title: Byron Allen Spares No One in Accusing Comcast of Racial Bias
description: He broke into the entertainment business as a teenager, playing comedy clubs in Los Angeles and making his first appearance on The Tonight Show at age 18. He gained fame as a host of the 1980s NBC hit Real People before founding Entertainment Studios in 1993. That company has grown into an empire, with a film division and nearly two dozen television properties, including the Weather Channel, which it acquired last year for $300 million.

title: How to Rebrand a Country
description: Twenty years ago, an opinion writer for The New York Times described Colombia as a country dominated by drug killings, paramilitary massacres, guerrilla kidnappings, death squad murders and street crime.

title: Elizabeth Warren Has Done the Hard Part. Now Comes the Harder Part.
description: VINTON, Iowa  Elizabeth Warren motors onstage at her campaign events like she is being chased: arm-pump, arm-pump, mid-jog wave. O.K.! Lets get this thing going.

title: How Juul Hooked a Generation on Nicotine
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In the face of mounting investigations, subpoenas and lawsuits, Juul Labs has insisted that it never marketed or knowingly sold its trendy e-cigarettes and flavored nicotine pods to teenagers.

title: AMC to Fire Workers Who Confronted Black Woman at Harriet Screening, Letter Says
description: When she saw a sold-out showing of the movie Harriet in Metairie, La., this month, Sandra Gordon thought the film was excellent  but the experience was fraught.

title: V.A.R. Check: In Premier League, Almost No One Is Happy
description: LONDON  Englands Premier League has long prided itself on the kind of soccer it sells to the world, a compelling product that it bills as a unique brand of high-octane, fast-and-furious soccer. So it is perhaps little surprise that the leagues introduction this season of video assistant refereeing  the game-pausing, controversy-inducing, fan-aggravating replay system in growing use worldwide  has been an uncommonly bad fit here, a case of sound and fury meeting a handbrake.

title: Hong Kong: A City Divided
description: Hong Kong has been roiled by protests for six months. We photographed people who took sides and took to the streets.

title: Fourth Spy Unearthed in U.S. Atomic Bomb Project
description: The worlds first atomic bomb was detonated on July 16, 1945, in the New Mexican desert  a result of a highly secretive effort code-named the Manhattan Project, whose nerve center lay nearby in Los Alamos. Just 49 months later, the Soviets detonated a nearly identical device in Central Asia, and Washingtons monopoly on nuclear arms abruptly ended.

title: Record Turnout in Hong Kong Vote After Months of Protests and Rising Violence
description: HONG KONG  After months of antigovernment protests in Hong Kong, voters on Sunday had a chance to voice their opinion on the citys future  and they turned out in droves, shattering the citys records for turnout.

title: Mike Pence Makes Unannounced Visit to Iraq
description: BAGHDAD  Vice President Mike Pence made an unexpected visit to Iraq on Saturday, arriving as protests aimed at toppling the Iraqi leadership and changing the political system continued to roil the country.

title: Want a Sweet Gig? Dont Coach the Toronto Maple Leafs
description: TORONTO  If there is one thing most hockey observers can agree on, its that coaching the Toronto Maple Leafs is a perilous job.

title: In Blockbuster Era, No Room at the Box Office for the Middlebrow
description: If you walked into ArcLight Cinemas in Sherman Oaks, Calif., on Friday looking for a movie to watch, you would have been greeted by a digital sign listing these offerings:

title: The Impeachment Hearings: What You Need to Know
description: Our reporters in Washington spent the week covering and making sense of the latest developments in the impeachment inquiry. If you didnt have time to watch the hearings on Capitol Hill, here are some articles to quickly catch you up.

title: U.S. Commander Warns of Iranian Attack in Middle East
description: MANAMA, Bahrain  The deployment of 14,000 additional American troops to the Persian Gulf region since the spring has probably not dissuaded Iran from planning a major attack on the scale of the recent missile and drone assault on Saudi Arabias oil fields, the commander of American forces in the Middle East says.

title: Who Needs Canvas? In Dakar, Street Artists Express Their Visions on Sides of Homes
description: DAKAR, Senegal  On one wall, the painting of a marabout, a Muslim holy man, peers out from behind a line hung with laundry. Nearby, a poster of an African woman in a bustle has been pasted to a house. Still further along, women socialize in front of a wall covered in an intricate black-and-white abstract pattern.

title: Must We Follow City Heating Rules if the Apartments Are Too Hot?
description: Q: After the city increased the nighttime minimum temperature for residential buildings to 62 degrees in 2017, the management of our East Village co-op reset the thermostat on the boiler. Now residents complain that apartments are overheated, and open their windows at night. The fuel costs in our small, low-income co-op are already $10,000 over budget. At the last shareholder meeting, residents unanimously agreed that apartments are too hot, but they rejected a proposal to set the thermostat to 55 degrees because they didnt want to violate city law. Does the law prohibit shareholders from voting to set the heat at a temperature that is mutually agreeable, if it is below the legal limit?

title: Picassos in the Garage? Artists Handyman Is Convicted of Hiding Stolen Works
description: LONDON  One September day in 2010, a man who said he was the former electrician of Pablo Picasso entered the Paris office of the Picasso estate, wheeling a suitcase filled with 271 of the Spaniards artworks.

title: 44 Cozy, Brothy Soups Our Readers Love
description: Warm up with a pot of Indonesian chicken soup (above), chickpea stew with orzo, one-pot French onion soup, and more recipes in the collection below.

title: Our Nation Is Being Torn Apart. Truth Is Questioned.
description: Over the last several weeks, each impeachment inquiry witness put the Trump presidency in greater peril. But it was Thursdays testimony from Fiona Hill that underscored the full breadth of the damage Russia has already done to the United States: Our nation is being torn apart; truth is questioned; our highly professional expert career Foreign Service is being undermined.

title: Evo Morales Raises a Fist, but Knows His Presidency is Over
description: MEXICO CITY  Evo Morales, the ousted president of Bolivia, now lives in exile on a military base in Mexico City, where he says he spends much of the day taking calls from Bolivians pleading for his help.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: ACROSTIC  Todays passage is about biography, the challenging art of writing truthfully and interestingly about one's fellow humans. Its by Laura Shapiro, and its taken from a book called What She Ate: Six Remarkable Women and the Food That Tells Their Stories. The women are Eleanor Roosevelt, Barbara Pym, Eva Braun (!), Rosa Lewis (the Queen of Cooks), Dorothy Wordsworth and Helen Gurley Brown, and the stories are wild  just a perfunctory glance at the summaries online revealed some things about Eleanor Roosevelt that Id never have guessed. Revenge is a dish!

title: Falling Birthrates: A Cause for Cheer or Fear?
description: To the Editor:

title: A Split Decision From Congress Will Leave Voters With Final Say on Trump
description: WASHINGTON  When it was all over and the witnesses had testified and the speeches were done, President Trump pronounced himself satisfied with the show. We had a tremendous week with the hoax, he declared on Friday as he addressed a room of collegiate athletes. Thats really worked out incredibly well.

title: Veterans Join Airlines in Pushback Against Conduct Unbecoming a Support Dog
description: WASHINGTON  It seemed, in retrospect, a bit of a low point  a medium-size dog racing through an airplane at 30,000 feet, spraying diarrhea toward passengers throughout the cabin.

title: Navy Is Said to Proceed With Disciplinary Plans Against Edward Gallagher
description: The secretary of the Navy and the admiral who leads the SEALs have threatened to resign or be fired if plans to expel a commando from the elite unit in a war crimes case are halted by President Trump, administration officials said Saturday.

title: Trumps White Whale
description: WASHINGTON  Donald Trump is a rodomont. Not to mention a grobian. And, of course, a Sinon suffering from proditomania.

title: If Protests Are an Infection, What Is Chinas Cure?
description: In a week when Hong Kongs universities became tear-gas-scented battlegrounds, the escalating violence has been matched by an intensifying spiral of rhetoric from the governments of Beijing and Hong Kong. Words have always been weapons in conflict, but in the social media age, their potential as tools of mobilization is exponentially multiplied, and the terminology used to describe protesters seems like a signal of tough action ahead.

title: Venezuelas Kids Are Dying. Are We Responsible?
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  This country is a kleptocracy ruled incompetently by thugs who are turning a prosperous oil-exporting nation into a failed state sliding toward starvation.

title: Social Media and the Populist Moment
description: Social media is bad for everything and everybody, for human beings and journalists and other living things. But at least it reliably generates interesting juxtapositions from which op-ed columns can be made  including columns about how a fixation on, well, social media, is damaging liberalisms understanding of the world.

title: Climate Change Protesters Disrupt Yale-Harvard Football Game
description: NEW HAVEN, Conn.  Climate change activists stormed the field at the Yale-Harvard football game on Saturday afternoon, disrupting the game at halftime in a protest to call attention to the universities to divest their investments in fossil fuels.

title: Go Ahead. Eat Your Holiday Feelings.
description: Emotional eating is part of being human.

title: Why Gratitude Is Wasted on Thanksgiving
description: Feeling grateful has many benefits, but they arent needed when youre already surrounded by friends and family.

title: Dont Mess With the Dressing. Dont Tinker With the Turkey.
description: Save the foodie stuff for the other 364 days of the year. Thanksgiving food is about memories.

title: A Honeymoon on a Harley
description: As a child, I kept photos of my parents in an old, torn shoe box. Id often gaze at the ones of them posing with my dads 1947 Harley Davidson Knucklehead, and try to imagine their days before I came along. Id wonder: What was it like for a white Appalachian man and a Salvadoran woman to ride a motorcycle cross-country in the postwar years? How had their love endured at a time when many Americans were hostile to interracial marriage?

title: Likud Rival Slams Netanyahu and Calls for Primary to Save the Country
description: JERUSALEM  A leading rival to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu from within his own party rebuked the longtime Israeli premier on Saturday for calling his indictment on corruption charges an attempted coup and demanded a primary election be held to replace Mr. Netanyahu and save the country.

title: Why Do Kids Love Terrible Music?
description: My Tiny Victory this week: hearing my 6-year-old quietly singing a Liz Phair song to herself. Because, as Paul Underwood wrote, there are evidence-based reasons why kids can listen to Baby Shark on repeat, yet wince when you play something  good. Paul consulted experts to understand why this happens, and he asked musicians with kids (like singer-songwriter Sharon Van Etten and Corin Tucker of Sleater-Kinney) for tips to improve a childs appreciation of said good music. My personal tip: Wait until they are distracted by crafting and put on your own music in the background.

title: In Coded 911 Call, Ohio Woman Requested the Police by Ordering a Pizza
description: When a woman in Oregon, Ohio, placed an order over the phone for a large pizza, the 911 dispatcher on the other end of the line told her she had the wrong number.

title: Why I Couldnt See My Dying Father One Last Time
description: One evening in May I got a call from my 83-year-old father in Iran. He was suffering from delirium and being treated at an excellent hospital in Lavasan, an upscale suburb in northern Tehran.

title: Open Wide!
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Today we have a Sunday puzzle without a theme, and an extravagance of interesting terms in a grid that sets the Sunday record for fewest entries  (122, if you were wondering, breaking a record set earlier this year by Joel Fagliano). Frank Longo, our constructor, is a professional puzzlemaker who sets up the Sunday spelling bee every week as well as the Premier Crossword for King Features Syndicate (and Sudokus and other puzzles). We havent seen a puzzle from him here for almost a decade.

title: Egypt Arrests Senior Editor of Independent News Outlet
description: Egyptian security forces arrested a senior editor of the countrys last significant independent news outlet on Saturday, in a new peak to a six-year-old crackdown on press freedom under President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi.

title: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg Hospitalized
description: [Read more on the return of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburgs cancer.]

title: Police Say They Foiled 2 Potential School Shootings in California
description: One week after a young man opened fire and killed two students at Saugus High School in Santa Clarita, Calif., the authorities said they have since thwarted at least two other potential school shootings in Los Angeles County.

title: Ohio State Passes Its First Test of the Season by Beating Penn State
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  For nearly three months, the Ohio State football team had stomped through its schedule like a ruthless cyborg, an army of scarlet and gray automatons executing play upon play upon play with little regard for the opponent or scoreboard.

title: How Did the Gettysburg Address End Up in Glenn Becks Office?
description: Only five known copies of the Gettysburg Address bear Abraham Lincolns handwriting. One sits beneath the Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library and Museum in Springfield, Ill., for much of the year, in a vault where the humidity and temperature are tightly controlled.

title: New Documents Reveal Details of Pompeos Role in Ukraine Affair
description: WASHINGTON  Internal State Department emails and documents released late Friday further implicate Secretary of State Mike Pompeo in a campaign orchestrated this year by President Trump and his personal lawyer Rudolph W. Giuliani to pressure Ukraine for political favors.

title: Canadian Men to Meet Spain in Davis Cup Final
description: MADRID  Winter is coming, but for Canadian tennis, the snowball effect is already a thing.

title: Corrections: Nov. 24, 2019
description: An article on Nov. 10 about ancient Puebloan civilization in the American Southwest misspelled part of the name of a mission church in New Mexico. It is San Estevan del Rey Mission Church, not San Estaban del Rey Mission Church.

title: Quotation of the Day: As Congress Plays to Draw, Voters Await
description: The impeachment jury is actually the smaller universe of voters in our country who are persuadable, swing voters who have avoided the tribalism plaguing most of our citizenry these days. Their verdict will be issued next fall.

title: Pia Cincotti, Michael Herzenberg
description: Pia Serena Cincotti and Michael Herzenberg were married Nov. 23 at the Metropolitan Club in New York. Mario Biaggi Jr., a friend of the couple who became a minister with American Marriage Ministries for the event, officiated.

title: Paige Esterkin, Jonathan Bronitsky
description: Paige Jessica Esterkin and Jonathan Bronitsky were married Nov. 23 at the Biltmore Hotel in Coral Gables, Fla. Rabbi Edwin Farber officiated.

title: Ann OConnell, Joseph Heaney
description: Ann Christina OConnell and Joseph Patrick Heaney were married Nov. 23 at the Union League Club in New York. Mariana Sanchez de Ovando, a minister with American Marriage Ministries and a friend of the couple, officiated.

title: Barie Salmon, David Miller
description: Dr. Barie Jessica Salmon and David Michael Miller were married Nov. 23 at the Fresh Meadow Country Club in Lake Success, N.Y. Rabbi Abraham Eckstein of Temple Israel of Great Neck, officiated.

title: Alexa Monroy, Alexander Fankuchen
description: Dr. Alexa Nicole Monroy and Alexander Kantrowitz Fankuchen were married Nov. 20 at the Hotel Bel Air in Los Angeles. Metty Fisseha, a Universal Life minister and a friend of the couple, officiated.

title: Mollie Meikle, Nathan Smith
description: Mollie Grace Mebert Meikle and Nathan Jacob Smith were married Nov. 23 at the Brooklyn Society for Ethical Culture. Bill de Blasio, the mayor of New York City, officiated.

title: Vilsa Curto, Igor Salitskiy
description: Vilsa Eliana Curto and Igor Salitskiy were married Nov. 23 at Stanford Memorial Church in Stanford, Calif. The Rev. Annanda G. Barclay, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony.

title: Mariel Davis, Fawzy Abu Seif
description: Mary Eleanor Teresa Davis and Fawzy Abu Seif were married Nov. 23 at the Convent of the Sacred Heart in New York. The imam Dr. Ahmet Atlig officiated, with Msgr. Kenneth Lasch leading a reflection and prayer during an interfaith ceremony.

title: Ann Marie Coviello, Marc Lyons
description: Ann Marie Coviello and Marc Anthony Lyons were married Nov. 23 in an outdoor ceremony at Congo Square in New Orleans. Sula Janet Evans, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Alexandra Goldstein, Ryan Authier
description: Alexandra Benjamin Goldstein and Ryan Daniel Authier were married Nov. 23 at Prospect House, an events space in Dripping Springs, Texas. Rabbi Lev Baesh officiated.

title: Margaret Greenberg, Erik Blumenkranz
description: Margaret Jasper Greenberg and Erik Davis Blumenkranz were married Nov. 19 in San Francisco. Patricia Mazzucco, a county clerk, officiated at City Hall. On Nov. 23, the couple took part in a celebration ceremony at Camp Maddox, the brides family property in Kerrville, Texas. David Greenberg, the uncle of the bride, led the ceremony.

title: Alexandra Lane, Fielder Valone
description: Alexandra Rae Lane and Thomas Fielder Valone Jr. were married Nov. 23 at the Detroit Institute of Arts. Christopher R. Browning, a friend of the groom who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Elizabeth Harrow, David Zussman
description: Elizabeth Rose Harrow and David Klein Zussman were married Nov. 23 at the 1 Hotel in Brooklyn. Rabbi Ethan Witkovsky officiated, with Cantor Azi Schwartz taking part.

title: Jonathan Naymark, Amit Paley
description: Jonathan David Naymark and Amit Reuveny Paley were married Nov. 23 at the Rainbow Room in New York. Rabbi Sharon Kleinbaum officiated.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: The American Music Awards and Meet Me in St. Louis
description: 2019 AMERICAN MUSIC AWARDS 8 p.m. on ABC. Ciara hosts this years A.M.A.s ceremony, which honors the music industrys top performers. As always, the night will feature an eclectic slate of live performances  this year, from Kesha and Big Freedia; Christina Aguilera featuring A Great Big World; and Post Malone, who will be joined by Ozzy Osbourne, Travis Scott and Watt. Selena Gomez will showcase new music, Green Day will celebrate the 25th anniversary of Dookie and Shania Twain will perform a medley of her greatest hits. Taylor Swift, who suggested earlier this month that her former label Big Machine was preventing her from singing her old songs on TV, is scheduled to be honored as artist of the decade.

title: Saturday Night Live: Will Ferrell Leads a Celebrity Extravaganza
description: Why even have a cast? This weekends episode of Saturday Night Live offered no shortage of celebrity guests sending up themselves and other famous figures, starting with the shows opening sketch, which once again featured Alec Baldwin as President Trump.

title: We Had Hardly Taken a Sip When I Heard a Voice Behind Me
description: Dear Diary:

title: Sam Darnold and the Jets Have an Explanation for His Improvement
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Jets quarterback Sam Darnold walked into Coach Adam Gases office after the teams sixth loss in seven games,  an Oct. 27 rout by the Jacksonville Jaguars during which Darnold threw three interceptions and was sacked eight times. The second-year quarterback had a clear agenda: to improve communication between himself and Gase.

title: Trying Out a Life on the Hill
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: With Boeing in Cross Hairs, Lion Air Gets a Pass on Poor Safety Record
description: When things go wrong, those in power often promise to make it right. But do they? In this series, The Times investigates to see if those promises were kept.

title: Trump Threw This Mission Into Chaos. The Military Is Scrambling To Save It.
description: On a rare visit to U.S. bases in eastern Syria, we saw how President Trumps message is being reinterpreted on the ground.

title: The Newest Tech on Cruise Ships
description: People who work on cruises often describe ships as cities at sea, but cities usually have speedy Wi-Fi, food delivery services you can summon on your phone, and homes with voice-activated assistants like Alexa, Siri and Google to answer questions and provide information.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $750,000
description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: Internet Companies Prepare to Fight the Deepfake Future
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Several months ago, Google hired dozens of actors to sit at a table, stand in a hallway and walk down a street while talking into a video camera.

title: A White Officer Shoots a Black Colleague, Deepening a Racial Divide
description: ST. LOUIS  Milton Green was in the driveway of his home on St. Louiss North Side one night when he suddenly found the barrel of a gun pointed in his direction. Right away, his police training kicked in: He pulled a badge from beneath his T-shirt and grabbed ahold of his service weapon, a 9-millimeter Beretta.

title: Student Sets Himself on Fire, Highlighting Broader Distress in France
description: PARIS  Early this month, Anas K., 22, sat in front of the student center at a university in Lyon and posted what he believed would be his final Facebook status.

title: Impeachment, Juul, Thanksgiving: Your Weekend Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Week in Business: WeWork Will Lay Off 1 in 5 Workers
description: Heres hoping you can avoid awkward political disagreements around the Thanksgiving table this week. (If thats impossible, check out this guide to diffusing the tension.) Or you could pivot the conversation to the latest business and tech news! Youre welcome.

title: Suspect Arrested in Anti-Semitic Harassment of Jewish Family
description: LONDON  A suspect has been arrested after a man was videotaped reading Bible passages to a Jewish man and a boy in the London Underground and accusing them of being impostors, in an episode of anti-Semitism that drew outrage.

title: Living a Life Interrupted by Bipolar Disorder
description: For more than two decades, Synika Gardners struggle with bipolar disorder has interfered with her education, her work and her relationships, particularly when it came to her three daughters.

title: Voters in Romania Reject Years of Scandals and Chaos
description: BUCHAREST, Romania  In late 2016, a populist political party swept to power in Romania promising generous social spending, tax cuts and a continuation of the countrys alignment with the European Union, nine years after it had joined the bloc.

title: The Great Unknown Movie of the Century So Far? Heres Mine
description: When I saw the name of the series coming up at Film at Lincoln Center  Relentless Invention: New Korean Cinema, 1996-2003  I thought that it would probably include the greatest unknown movie of the century so far. Sure enough, it does.

title: Michael Bloomberg Joins 2020 Democratic Field for President
description: Michael R. Bloomberg announced on Sunday that he would run for president in 2020, bringing his enormous wealth and eclectic political biography into the tumultuous Democratic primary and seeking to win over skeptical liberal voters by presenting himself as a multibillion-dollar threat to President Trump.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. I was in London a few years ago to watch Yotam Ottolenghi make a feast for a bunch of friends. I wrote about it for The Times, and every time I cook a big meal I come back to the opening scene in the article. That is: How before cooking anything, Yotam hauled out the china he would be using to serve the food and determined which recipes were destined for which platter, which bowl.

title: Goo Hara, K-Pop Star of the Group Kara, Is Found Dead
description: The former K-pop band member Goo Hara was found dead on Sunday in her home in Seoul, South Korea, in what the police were calling a suicide. She was 28.

title: The Struggles of the Female Athlete
description: To the Editor:

title: Jeffrey Epsteins Death Shows the Need for Prison Reform
description: To the Editor:

title: New Suspect Charged in Trafficking After Truck Deaths in Britain
description: LONDON  The police in Essex, England, have charged another man with human trafficking in the deaths of 39 Vietnamese people whose bodies were found in the refrigerated trailer of a truck in October.

title: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg Discharged From Hospital
description: WASHINGTON  Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was released from the hospital on Sunday after treatment for chills and a fever, a Supreme Court spokeswoman said. She is home and doing well, said the spokeswoman, Kathleen Arberg.

title: How an Unknown Female Senator Came to Replace the Bolivian President Evo Morales
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia  A day after the downfall of Bolivias longest-serving president, Evo Morales, the country was in chaos: Soldiers and protesters were out in the streets, looters terrorized the suburbs and no one was in charge.

title: Leaked China Files Show Internment Camps Are Ruled by Secrecy and Spying
description: HONG KONG  As the government accelerated mass detentions of Muslim minorities in northwest China, a senior official issued a secret directive giving detailed orders for how the rapidly expanding indoctrination camps holding them should be managed.

title: For Holiday Ads, Nothing Says Tradition Like Cardi Bs Twerk Shop
description: In a 22nd-floor suite of the Ritz-Carlton in Manhattan, sipping a nonalcoholic sparkling ros from Pepsi, I was waiting for Cardi B to talk to me about Christmas.

title: China Didnt Want Us to Know. Now Its Own Files Are Doing the Talking.
description: No more denying, no more dodging. The Chinese Communist Party can no longer hide its relentless campaign of mass internment against the ethnic minorities in the northwestern region of Xinjiang, or claim that the effort is an innocuous educational program. What was already widely known, vastly reported and confirmed by firsthand accounts has now been proved beyond doubt by the governments own records  gigabytes of files, reams of reports, thousands of spreadsheets  some of them classified and highly confidential.

title: Bloomberg News Sets Out How It Will Cover Its Owner
description: Get ready to cover the bosss presidential campaign, with some caveats.

title: Hong Kong Election Results Give Democracy Backers Big Win
description: HONG KONG  Pro-democracy candidates buoyed by months of street protests in Hong Kong won a stunning victory in local elections on Sunday, as record numbers voted in a vivid expression of the citys aspirations and its anger with the Chinese government.

title: French Luxury Giant LVMH Nears Deal to Buy Tiffany
description: LVMH Mot Hennessy Louis Vuitton will be having a lot of breakfasts at Tiffanys  as well as lunches, dinners and board meetings.

title: University to Students on Medicaid: Buy Private Coverage, or Drop Out
description: Emily and Kullen Langston were enrolling in classes for the winter semester at Brigham Young University-Idaho when they hit an unexpected roadblock.

title: Public Option Draws Voters Unsure About Medicare for All
description: CONCORD, N.H.  One after another, voters at a recent campaign event here for former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. expressed utter comfort with the centerpiece of his health care platform: an idea once so controversial that Democrats had to drop it from the Affordable Care Act to get the landmark law passed.

title: Newscasters Errant Email Calling in Sick Gets National Attention
description: The care packages came streaming in to the television station: ginger ale, tissues and chicken noodle soup.

title: Mary Previte, Grateful Survivor of a Concentration Camp, Dies at 87
description: Mary Taylor Previte lived a life of self-reinvention, becoming a teacher, a lauded administrator of a center for troubled youths and a New Jersey legislator. But perhaps her most transformative experience was one of imprisonment and liberation during World War II, and then what came afterward.

title: Frozen 2 Opens to $127 Million
description: Frozen 2 was a bit of a gamble: Rarely do musical sequels succeed, and this movie was being released a whopping six years after the original.

title: Youre Tracked Everywhere You Go Online. Use This Guide to Fight Back.
description: Welcome to the Smarter Living newsletter! Every Monday, S.L. editor Tim Herrera emails readers with tips and advice for living a better, more fulfilling life. Sign up here to get it in your inbox.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | Nov. 25, 2019
description: Students

title: Your Monday Briefing
Dorothy Seiberling, Influential Arts Editor, Dies at 97
description: Dorothy Seiberling, an influential magazine editor who championed modern artists, died on Saturday in Wilmington, Del. She was 97.

title: Why President Trumps Ukraine Scheme Matters
description: Over the last two weeks, in sworn testimony from experienced public servants with no political axes to grind, the American people have learned that President Trump orchestrated a scheme to extract what he called a favor from a foreign leader by withholding a White House meeting and hundreds of millions of dollars in military aid, against his own administrations policy and the bipartisan wishes of Congress.

title: Egypt Escalates Pressure on Last Major Independent News Site
description: CAIRO  Egyptian security forces on Sunday escalated their pressure on the last major independent news outlet in the country, raiding its offices and temporarily detaining three top editors. Another editor of the publication, Mada Masr, had been arrested on Saturday.

title: Jimmy Butler Returns to Another Franchise Left Behind
description: PHILADELPHIA  There is no doubt that Jimmy Butler is one of the best basketball players in the world and has been for some time. He is tenacious on both ends of the floor and unafraid of any opponent or moment.

title: Her Battles With the Press Corps Behind Her, Sanders Plans a Political Future
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark.  It has been less than six months since Sarah Huckabee Sanders left Washington after a tumultuous tenure as President Trumps press secretary who was mocked so mercilessly at the White House Correspondents Dinner that other members of the Trump administration walked out.

title: How Taylor Swift Dragged Private Equity Into Her Fight Over Music Rights
description: A little over a week ago, a troubling alert appeared on the smartphone of an executive at the private equity giant the Carlyle Group: The firm had been invoked by Taylor Swift.

title: Review: Ballet Hispnico, Piercing Stereotypes
description: Have you ever noticed how a film-set clapperboard snaps shut like the mouth of a shark? The Belgian-Colombian choreographer Annabelle Lopez Ochoa has.

title: Teacher Threw Away Students Black Lives Matter Posters, A.C.L.U. Says
description: A school district near Sacramento, Calif., said it is investigating an episode in which a teacher threw away student posters related to the Black Lives Matter movement.

title: Esper Demands Resignation of Navy Secretary Over SEAL Case
description: WASHINGTON  Defense Secretary Mark T. Esper demanded the resignation of the Navys top civilian leader on Sunday, an abrupt move aimed at ending an extraordinary dispute between President Trump and his own senior military leadership over the fate of a SEAL commando in a war crimes case.

title: Reason to Raid the Fridge
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  A quick column today, to go with Daniel Mauers smooth, fast-solving Monday puzzle.

title: One of R. Kellys Few Defenders Says She Was His Victim, Too
description: Editors Note: On Tuesday, Nov. 26, the website Patreon deleted the posts published under Joycelyn Savages name, saying it could not verify that they were written by her.

title: A Threat Against Times Square on Reddit, and Police Are Mobilized
description: Early on Sunday morning, the New York governors office received a concerning message from law enforcement officials: Someone had made a threat online to detonate a bomb in Times Square.

title: Jets Offense Pours It On Against Raiders
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  A torrential pregame downpour turned into a light drizzle at kickoff, giving the Jets ideal conditions for their offensive deluge in a 34-3 win over the Oakland Raiders on Sunday afternoon at MetLife Stadium.

title: 5-Year-Old Boy Thrown From Mall of America Balcony Is Walking Again
description: When a stranger threw a 5-year-old boy from the Mall of Americas third-floor balcony in April, the boy fell nearly 40 feet, broke both his arms and a leg, and fractured his face and skull.

title: Biden Is Struggling in Iowa and His Supporters There Know Why
description: WINTERSET, Iowa  Nancy Courtney displays a Joe Biden sign in her yard, makes phone calls for his campaign and supports the former vice president 100 percent, she said. But the sluggish state of Joseph R. Biden Jr.s organization in her city of Burlington, Iowa, had her fuming one recent evening.

title: For Trump, Impeachment Is a Show
description: The point is proven. The corruption has been established.

title: I Invented the World Wide Web. Heres How We Can Fix It.
description: My parents were mathematicians. My mother helped code one of the first stored-program computers  the Manchester Mark 1. They taught me that when you program a computer, what you can do is limited only by your imagination. That excitement for experimentation and change helped me build the World Wide Web.

title: Why I Wear Five Wedding Rings
description: NASHVILLE  Whenever Im nervous, I find some sort of amulet to drop into my pocket. A buckeye. A feather molted from a blue jays tail. The river rock my middle son always called a worry stone. The spent egg sac from a praying mantis. A seashell from my mother-in-laws grave. I hold onto whats in my pocket the way an anxious baby clings to a beloved blanket at bedtime.

title: Spain Beats Canada to Win Davis Cup at Home
description: MADRID  With nothing left to prove at this stage, Rafael Nadal went out and proved something more.

title: Mulvaney Asked About Legal Justification for Withholding Ukraine Aid
description: Mick Mulvaney, the acting White House chief of staff, asked officials in the budget office after President Trumps July 25 call with the Ukrainian president whether there was a legal justification for withholding hundreds of millions of dollars in military aid to Ukraine, according to two people briefed on an internal White House review.

title: Turn Off Your Phone for Thanksgiving
description: This week, Americans will endure flight delays, traffic jams and other logistical miseries to spend time with family and friends. And when the holiday weekend is ending, many will lament that they dont get to spend enough time with those relatives and friends.

title: Who Is Edward Gallagher, the SEAL the Navy Wants to Expel?
description: The Navy and President Trump have been in a tug of war over Chief Petty Officer Edward Gallagher, the Navy SEAL at the center of a highly publicized war crimes case. The Navy prosecuted Chief Gallagher and wanted to expel him from the SEALs, but the president, as commander in chief, has repeatedly intervened in the sailors favor.

title: 82 Days Underwater: The Tide Is High, but Theyre Holding On
description: KEY LARGO, Fla.  Before he leaves for work, Rick Darden, an accountant with his own firm, stuffs a long-sleeved shirt, slacks and dress shoes in a backpack. Then he heads out, clad in shorts and waders, for the half-mile trek through the seawater that has flooded the streets of his Florida Keys neighborhood for the past 82 days.

title: Devin Nunes Denounces Reports He Played a Role in Ukraine
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Devin Nunes, an outspoken defender of President Trump in his impeachment hearings, said on Sunday that reports that he played a role in the effort to dig up damaging information on former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. in Ukraine were part of a criminal campaign against him by a totally corrupt news media.

title: Hong Kong Election Results Mapped
description: More than half of the 452 seats in Sundays local district council elections flipped from pro-Beijing to pro-democracy candidates.

title: Crunchtime at a Food Bank
description: This article is from the Nov. 24 issue of The New York Times for Kids, a special print section that appears monthly.

title: Cargo Ship With Almost 15,000 Sheep Overturns Near Romania
description: A ship carrying almost 15,000 sheep overturned on Sunday in the Black Sea near Romania, according to news reports, setting off a desperate effort to rescue the animals and renewing a focus on the livestock shipping industry, which has been previously criticized for its treatment of animals.

title: Luis Lacalle Pou Leads in Tight Uruguay Election, but Ballot Counting Continues
description: BUENOS AIRES  Former Senator Luis Lacalle Pou appeared to have carved out a narrow victory in Uruguays presidential election on Sunday, the latest sign that unrest simmering across Latin America favors anti-incumbent candidates.

title: Review: The Many Unusual Stages of Fefu and Her Friends
description: Why would a playwright design a play so that the most moving thing in it is the audience?

title: Review: A Heartbreaker Returns in The Young Man From Atlanta
description: Lets talk about the Disappointment Club and the wonders wrought so quietly by Horton Foote. This presumably apocryphal organization crops up often in The Young Man From Atlanta, the Foote play that opened Sunday in an affectionate, slow and steady revival by Michael Wilson for the Signature Theater.

title: Watchmen Season 1, Episode 6 Recap: Nostalgia
description: Every episode of Watchmen dances along the precipice of catastrophic failure, like a circus performer who has waved away the safety net, despite the abundant junctures where he could go splat. The safety net being waved away here is Alan Moore and Dave Gibbonss canonical graphic novel, which Damon Lindelof and his writers have accepted as history but rejected as scripture. Until now, the extent to the shows audacity has been to imagine events before and after the time frame of the book, using the Tulsa massacre of 1921 as the jumping off point for a modern story about the legacy of racism and violent white supremacy. Scenes from Moore and Gibbonss book have been recreated, often in the context of the American Hero Story show-within-a-show, but rarely revised.

title: Watchmen Pulls the Hood on Hooded Justice
description: This article contains spoilers for Season 1, Episode 6 of HBOs Watchmen.

title: Rappers Are Singers Now. Thank Drake.
description: At the end of 2009, the most popular song in the country was Empire State of Mind, the hoary, inflated, thudding collaboration between Jay-Z and Alicia Keys. It was perhaps the final evolutionary form  a mealy and edgeless arena ballad  of the rapper-singer collaborations that, over the prior two-plus decades, had come to dominate hip-hop and, increasingly, pop.

title: When Instagram Killed the Tabloid Star
description: Celebrity culture, in the first decade of this century, took the form of a kind of misogynistic death cult. Somewhere in Hollywood, Lindsay Lohan was falling out of an S.U.V. Tara Reid was falling out of a club nearby. It was open season on drunk girls. Flashbulbs alighted on their smeared mascara and slackened jaws. Upskirt photographs, in which a paparazzo literally stooped so low that he could snap under a womans skirt as she exited a car, were a genre unto themselves.

title: Women Writers Give Voice to Their Rage
description: The first word in Western literature, according to the classicist Mary Beard, is wrath, which opens the Iliad, written in the eighth century B.C.

title: A Sea Change in the Art World, Made by Black Creators
description: What made the 2010s the most thrilling of all the decades Ive spent in the New York art world was the rising presence of black artists of every ilk, on every front: in museums, commercial galleries, art magazines, private collections and public commissions.

title: The 10 Most Influential Films of the Decade (and 20 Other Favorites)
description: The most popular movies and the movies we love most arent always the ones that shape the industry, reflect the times or change the terms of cultural discourse  for better or worse. The films on the first list, whether we like them or not (and in some cases we very much did), made a difference in the world of entertainment and beyond. In a politicized time, their impact was often measured in ideological terms, by the arguments they started and the passions they inflamed. And at a time of blockbuster hegemony and streaming ascendancy, they also represented a business and an audience in constant and sometimes confusing flux.

title: Mr. Robot Season 4, Episode 8 Recap: Prisoners
description: Last week, Mr. Robot dropped a bomb on its protagonist. This week, the fallout began.

title: 33 Ways to Remember the 2010s
description: A look back at what we watched, heard, read, liked and shared.

title: British Man and Filipino Woman Rescued From Kidnappers in Philippines
description: MANILA  Philippine special forces on Monday rescued a 70-year-old British national and a Filipino woman nearly two months after they were kidnapped by gunmen in the southern Philippines, the military said.

title: No Corrections: Nov. 25, 2019
Across Northern England, Labours Red Wall Is Showing Cracks
description: KIRKBY-IN-ASHFIELD, England  The red brick houses that march up a gentle rise in this worse-for-wear town have long stood as part of the red wall in British politics, the gritty stronghold of coal and factory towns in the Midlands and north of England that voted as reliably for the Labour Party as blue-collar precincts in the American Midwest once voted for the Democrats.

title: Tiffanys, Davis Cup, Tories: Your Monday Briefing
description: Six internal documents obtained by the International Consortium of Investigative Journalists shed new light on Chinas crackdown in the Xinjiang region, where a million or more ethnic Uighurs, Kazakhs and others have been detained over the past three years.

title: American Aid Worker for U.N. Is Killed in Afghan Capital
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  An American national working for the United Nations in Afghanistan was killed and two others were wounded in a blast targeting a U.N. vehicle in Kabul on Sunday, officials said, underscoring a growing threat to aid workers.

title: Whats on TV Monday: Slings & Arrows and the Dancing with the Stars finale
description: SLINGS & ARROWS Stream on Acorn TV. In Season 1 of this cult-favorite Canadian comedy from the 2000s, Geoffrey Tennant (Paul Gross) is lured back to the Shakespearean theater festival he had fled when its artistic director, Oliver Welles (Stephen Ouimette), dies unexpectedly. Geoffrey tries to make his peace with Oliver, who appears to him as a ghost, and Ellen Fanshaw (Martha Burns), his former lover, while he works to save a production of Hamlet. Season 2, which is available beginning Monday, revolves around Macbeth, a play whose difficulty begins to threaten Geoffreys sanity. While Geoffrey deals with artistic issues, Richard Smith-Jones (Mark McKinney), the festivals manager, struggles with a new advertising campaign and Ellen is forced to deal with the tax authorities. The third and final season will be available Dec. 16. Margaret Lyons, a Times TV critic, recently wrote: Its one of my favorite shows ever, and one that gets better and better the more you watch it.

title: Word + Quiz: pugilist
Kristin Scott Thomas on Playing a Different Kind of Part
description: Last week, Kristin Scott Thomas, the British actress, found herself in an enormous meeting room in the bowels of the Louvre museum, rubbing shoulders with Marlne Schiappa, the French Minister for Equality; Franois-Henri Pinault, the C.E.O. of Kering; and Anne Hidalgo, the mayor of Paris.

title: Niners Dominance Is Creating Lore for a New Era
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif.  Kevin and Tara Stinson have waited five years for Levis Stadium to feel like home. When they had season tickets at Candlestick Park, where the San Francisco 49ers played until 2013, the tailgating was livelier, the stadium was noisier and the fans were family. In the half-decade since the 49ers moved to Silicon Valley, the Stinsons, who bought season tickets here, too, have watched a merry-go-round of coaches, quarterbacks and losing teams that won just 25 games in the past five seasons. The teams marketing slogan, Faithful Then, Faithful Now seemed like more of a question than a statement.

title: Company Behind Fearless Girl Statue Goes to Court Over Replicas
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  She stands four feet high, with her hands placed on her hips, her chin up and a defiant look in her eye. Known as the Fearless Girl, the bronze statue in Lower Manhattan was intended to drive a conversation on the importance of elevating women in corporate roles  a feminist message amplified by replicas that have popped up in cities around the world.

title: Luxury Giant LVMH to Buy Tiffany for $16.2 Billion
description: LVMH Mot Hennessy Louis Vuitton, the worlds largest luxury goods company, said on Monday that it had reached an agreement to buy the jeweler Tiffany & Company in a $16.2 billion deal, the largest ever in the luxury sector.

title: Why Giuliani Singled Out 2 Ukrainian Oligarchs to Help Look for Dirt
description: VIENNA  They were two Ukrainian oligarchs with American legal problems. One had been indicted on federal bribery charges. The other was embroiled in a vast banking scandal and was reported to be under investigation by the F.B.I.

title: She Wants to Row to Get From N.Y.C. Into College
description: Rainy-day practices are the worst, especially in the cold. As she leads her rowing team, Sebastiana Lopez feels the rain pelting her face, soaking her clothes and working its way into her bones. Her fingers go numb.

title: Suicides by K-Pop Stars Prompt Soul-Searching in South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea  When the K-pop star Sulli ended her own life last month, her fellow K-pop singer Goo Hara was heartbroken, bidding a farewell to her best friend in a live-streaming video. With tears running down her cheeks, Ms. Goo expressed hope that Sulli would live as she pleases in heaven.

title: Lesson of the Day: A 6-Year-Old Asks Why There Are No Female Toy Soldiers. Now, There Will Be.
description: Featured Article: A 6-Year-Old Asks Why There Are No Female Toy Soldiers. Now, There Will Be.

title: Meet 5 of Hong Kongs Newest Politicians
description: HONG KONG  Hong Kongs district council election saw the pro-establishment camp have one of its biggest defeats since the territory returned to Chinese control 22 years ago, as dozens of seasoned politicians were replaced with a crop of newcomers, many of whom were inspired to run by the antigovernment protests.

title: Pope Francis, in Japan, Warns of Selfish Decisions on Nuclear Energy
description: TOKYO  In the first visit to Japan by a pontiff in 38 years, Pope Francis on Monday edged close to calling for the renunciation of all nuclear power in a country that experienced the worst nuclear disaster since Chernobyl but has yet to determine a viable alternative for its energy needs.

title: This Was Hong Kongs Most Important Election Ever
description: HONG KONG  The people of Hong Kong dont get to choose their government. But that hasnt stopped them from finding ways to express what they think about it.

title: The Whos Pete Townshend on Rocks Legacy, and His Own Dark Past
description: We dont have the brains to answer the question of what it was that rock n roll tried to start and has failed to finish.

title: Air Pollution May Damage the Brain
description: Long-term exposure to air pollution is associated with lower scores on tests of mental acuity, researchers have found. And one reason may be that air pollution causes changes in brain structure that resemble those of Alzheimers disease.

title: Sticking to My Own Premises
description: Amid mounting excitement about the kids flying in for a visit, I look around the apartment with trepidation. Why am I so nervous about their imminent arrival? It has been months since our last get-together and they can replace ceiling light bulbs too risky for me or my older husband to reach.

title: From the Highest Heights to the Lowest Depths, in Photographs
description: CLIMBING ROCK Vertical Explorations Across North America By Franois Lebeau and Jesse Lynch

title: How the 2020 Democrats Responded to an Abortion Survey
description: The New York Times asked the Democratic presidential candidates to complete a survey on abortion and contraception. Following are the full responses we received, unedited except for corrected typos and punctuation.

title: A Rare Case Where Racial Biases Protected African-Americans
description: When the opioid crisis began to escalate some 20 years ago, many African-Americans had a layer of protection against it.

title: Dreading Thanksgiving? Pack One of These Books for Moral Support
description: We dont want you heading into the Thanksgiving weekend with a bad attitude, we just want you to be prepared for the inevitable: like relatives bickering over politics.

title: You Dont Have to Be a Minimalist to Share a Studio
description: Moving in together can be a challenge for even the most well-adjusted couple. And moving into a studio apartment together? Well, Kirsten Do admitted to feeling a twinge of concern hauling her stuff up the stairs to her boyfriends Murray Hill studio last month.

title: Could Donald Jr. or Lara Trump Run for Office in New York, and Win?
description: In some Republican circles, the notion of President Trumps children running for political office is not only a parlor game  its a matter of finding the right opportunity for the right Trump.

title: Can Trump Challenge His Impeachment in the Supreme Court?
description: WASHINGTON  If the partisan Dems ever tried to Impeach, President Trump wrote on Twitter in the spring, I would first head to the U.S. Supreme Court.

title: Black Voters to Black Candidates: Representation Is Not Enough
description: ATLANTA  Chyna Hester knew what she was supposed to say.

title: These Prosecutors Promised Change. Their Power Is Being Stripped Away.
description: While Lamar Johnson has spent 24 years in a Missouri prison, evidence of his innocence has steadily mounted. Two other men who confessed to the murder attributed to Mr. Johnson said he did not do it. And the only eyewitness against him  without whom prosecutors said they had no case  later recanted.

title: The Costly, Life-Disrupting Consequences of Poor Diabetes Care
description: Diabetes, whether Type 1 or Type 2, may be the most underappreciated, misunderstood and poorly treated of all common medical problems, and many of the more than 30 million Americans affected by it are paying dearly with their health and lives as a result.

title: Should Texting While Driving Be Treated Like Drunken Driving?
description: Though texting and driving is banned in most states, the law still typically treats it as a misdemeanor, punishable by a fine. However, some states are pushing to treat texting while driving as a more serious offense, on par with drunken driving.

title: On Abortion Rights, 2020 Democrats Move Past Safe, Legal and Rare
description: The Democratic presidential field has coalesced around an abortion rights agenda more far-reaching than anything past nominees have proposed, according to a New York Times survey of the campaigns. The positions reflect a hugely consequential shift on one of the countrys most politically divisive issues.

title: The Thanksgiving Traditionalists
description: My mother liked a loud (and, given our family, distinctly off-key) rendition of the hymn We Gather Together to kick off Thanksgiving dinner. The internet tells me its a Dutch Calvinist hymn of thanks for victory (in 1597) over Catholic Spain, so Im not absolutely sure what it meant to my mother, who grew up in an Orthodox Jewish family in Brooklyn in the 1930s. Still, she taught us the one verse she knew, and we all obliged.

title: Corruption Inquiry Spreads to U.A.W. Lakeside Resort
description: ONAWAY, Mich.  The United Auto Workers union is based in Detroit, but its spiritual home lies 250 miles to the north, in a dense and remote forest on the shore of Black Lake.

title: Why Does Rage Define Parasite and Other Popular East Asian Movies?
description: Editors note: This article contains spoilers for Parasite.

title: I Have a Ph.D. in Not Having Money
description: David Velasquez learned his first clinical lesson early on: The health care system wasnt made to care for people like him. Mr. Velasquez, 24, never had a primary care physician, because his parents, immigrants from Nicaragua, couldnt afford the bills. When he was 12, his undocumented godmother died of cancer, having avoided hospitals until it was too late. Mr. Velasquez, the only college-bound member of his family, knew he needed to become a doctor.

title: U.S. Resumes Large-Scale Operations Against ISIS in Northern Syria
description: MANAMA, Bahrain  United States troops have resumed large-scale counterterrorism missions against the Islamic State in northern Syria, military officials say, nearly two months after President Trumps abrupt order to withdraw American troops opened the way for a bloody Turkish cross-border offensive.

title: What We Learned in N.F.L. Week 12
description: There was stability at the top in N.F.L. Week 12. The San Francisco 49ers improved to 10-1 for the first time since 1997 with a huge win over the Green Bay Packers, while the New England Patriots and the Seattle Seahawks came away with crucial, albeit ugly, victories. Things were far more exciting for lesser teams like the Jets, the Cleveland Browns and the Tennessee Titans, each of whom enjoyed a day of pure dominance. The week, however, belonged to Frank Gore, the ageless running back who ran right past a legend in the record books.

title: Hut Skiing in the Dolomites: Storybook Scenery and Grappa Included
description: Every mountain is unique, sure. But, the rhythm of most ski resorts is predictable. So, when I heard about a ski safari in the Italian Alps, that involved crisscrossing the scenic towns and valleys of places like Cortina, Civetta, Val Gardena and Arabba, then sleeping at a different alpine inn each night (sadly, no tiger tracking), I was intrigued.

title: Multi-Mountain Passes Upended the American Ski Trip. Here Are 9 Rules.
description: For decades, ski vacations followed a predictable pattern, and it went a little like this: pick a mountain, book accommodations, fly or drive to the resort, buy lift tickets, ski a few days, return home. Repeat cycle the following year.

title: Uber Is Fighting to Survive in London After Losing Its License
description: LONDON  Uber suffered a major blow on Monday after London transportation authorities made a surprise decision to not extend its taxi operating license because of persistent safety problems, throwing into question whether the company can continue operating in its most lucrative European market.

title: Streets Where Cars Arent Welcome
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: Michael Bloomberg, Hong Kong, Tiffany: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Trumps Election May Have Been the Shock We Needed
description: As impeachment mania grips Washington, it is easy to descend into an ever-deepening political pessimism. But as odd as it may seem, for the first time in years, Im optimistic about the future of American democracy. It might be because Ive been reading more history and less news. And from the long arc of American political history, I see the bright flashing arrows of a new age of reform and renewal ahead.

title: Glenn Greenwald: I Was Assaulted Live On Air. This Is Bolsonaros Brazil.
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  On Nov. 7, I was physically assaulted by a far-right, pro-Bolsonaro pundit, Augusto Nunes, at a television and radio studio in So Paulo while we were live on the air.

title: What Should Happen to the Navy SEAL Chief?
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: Via Apple Podcasts | Via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Watchmen Dares to Imagine a Righteous Black Vigilante
description: This essay includes spoilers for the sixth episode of HBOs Watchmen.

title: Charles Schwab to Buy TD Ameritrade as Free Trading Takes Over
description: More than 40 years ago, Charles Schwab pioneered discount investing  an upstart firm championing cheaper broker services for the little guy.

title: DealBook: Will It Be Billionaire vs. Billionaire in the 2020 Election?
description: Good morning. Charles Schwab said it would acquire TD Ameritrade for $26 billion  a deal that brings together two of the largest online brokerage firms totaling roughly $5 trillion in assets. (Was this email forwarded to you? Sign up here.)

title: Royal Jewels of Immeasurable Value Are Stolen From a German Museum
description: BERLIN  Thieves broke into a museum in the eastern German city of Dresden early Monday and made off with three collections of jewelry from the royal house of Saxony, made of gold and precious stones, that authorities said were of immeasurable historical and cultural value.

title: Scientists Created Fake Rhino Horn. But Should We Use It?
description: In Africa, 892 rhinos were poached for their horns in 2018, down from a high of 1,349 killed in 2015. The decline in deaths is encouraging, but conservationists agree that poaching still poses a dire threat to Africas rhino population, which hovers around 24,500 animals.

title: Hong Kong Election Landslide Signals More Frictions With Beijing
description: HONG KONG  In the run-up to local elections in Hong Kong on Sunday, Beijing and its allies in the city were portraying the vote as a way to hear the voice of a silent majority after nearly six months of increasingly violent antigovernment protests.

title: Taylor Swift and Four More American Music Awards Moments
description: The 47th annual American Music Awards were held Sunday night at the Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles. Though awards were handed to new stars like Post Malone, Billie Eilish and Halsey, the show gave plenty of screen time to comparative veterans like Kesha, the Jonas Brothers and Toni Braxton. Here are five of the events notable moments.

title: What You Get for $1 Million in California
description: A floating house in Sausalito; a brand-new home with a pool and outdoor fireplace in Palm Springs; and an 1853 Greek Revival mansion in Sacramento.

title: $1 Million Homes in California
